Reviews.Title: “BEST BUY CONVENIENT, COMFORTABLE, FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: bob f
Reviews.Content: stayed for two wonderful weeks March 14 thru 27 2012 loved it. Very quiet street with restaurants on the same street, short walk to Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps also very near the Vittoriano monument and Piazza Venezia a few more blocks and you are at the Pantheon and Piazza Navonna or shop along Via del Corso. The hotel is extremely clean and super friendly just off via Nazionale short walk to Metro also Mini Electric bus stops about one hundred meters on the right. You are made to feel at home with a lovely breakfast every morning. We would not hesitate going back.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to discover Rome”
Reviews.Author: catie2000
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a narrow cobbled street close to the Colosseum, with lots of great local restaurants, shops and bars. The hotel itself occupies one floor of an old apartment building with a very old lift. The reception area is tiny, but the rooms themselves are a good standard with very nice bathrooms and showers. We occupied three rooms and the location was ideal, as was the room layout. Breakfast is good, served in the garden under a marquee, nice coffee, great pastries. My only criticism was that there were no fresh rolls, only sliced bread for toast, disappointing given the great bakeries nearby. But that is a minor criticism for what is a very well run little hotel ideally situated for a short break sightseeing in this most interesting and beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BASE FOR ROME CITY CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: merchant
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews on this site and really glad I did. I will agree with many of the visitors who speak about the friendlieness of staff, its great location and splendid rooms. The hotel lies just off the Via Nazionale which one of Rom'e main central streets and is about a ten minute walk from the colloseum and Roman Forum. By walking through a nearby traffic tunnel, the Trevi is about the same distance away. It is really within walking distance of about every single tourist attraction. We ate every night at one of the small restaurants on the same street as the hotel and had terrific value for money meals. The small shop across the road also had the cheapest wine and beer anywhere around. The hotel itself is small with rooms on the first floor. Breakfast is a very nice continental buffet within a small 'marquee tent' in the rear courtyard. It looked a bit bizarre but was actually very nice. we stayed in room 103 which was situated at the front. The room was larger than I expected with a decent sized ensuite and large shower. I was pleasantly surprised with the the well stocked mini bar which was the most inexpensive I have ever seen. We took a taxi to the hotel from the Leaonardo Da Vinci airport at 40 Euros and the hotel booked a private car for our return at 45 Euros. I definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly return. Please contact me if you need any further information.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sandy2027
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights in late January. It is just like in the photos, in fact better. We thought this Hotel was outstanding. Yes, some of the wall paper in our room was a little warn, but we found everything well maintained and spotlessly clean. The room and ensuite bathroom is more spacious than it appears in the pictures and is very well done. We found the Hotel safe and secure throughout our stay. The lovely Italian family who run this Hotel are very hands on, and manage it all superbly. Our breakfasts were the best in our 6 weeks overseas. A wide range of pastries, cereals, cheeses and cold meats, fruit juices and much more. We loved the way how when we arrived at breakfast, they greeted us with a delicious cappacino or other coffee of our choice. It was even better, than the best reviews here. The art nouveau building was beautiful. As I had broken my foot before our stay, we also appreciated the art nouveau lift which functions perfectly. The Italian family who own and manage this Hotel were exceptional. They quickly figured out that the reason we waited such a long time at breakfast was because I needed to rest before we went out (with foot), and they cleaned our room first without our having to ask. They showed us tremendous care and thoughtfulness throughout our stay. We cannot recommend them highly enough. The hotel is in a fantastic location as it is close to the Forum and Colossum, but off the tourist trap. We dined at all the restaurants in the street over our stay. The Umbrian restaurant is one Italians make a pilgramage to and it is outstanding (as foodies we loved it and dined there four nights and want to go back). But the other restaurants in this street and close to this Hotel are excellent too with top Italian food. We really felt as though we were in the heart of Rome, and central to all the attractions. The taxi arranged by the Hotel to the airport was very reliable. The total experience was top rate. We loved it here, and want to go back to Rome - and will definitely stay in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: custard
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we needed for our short break in Rome, The location is excellent with pretty much everything within walking distance, the hotel is in a character building which is nice. The rooms are clean and have everything you need, no Wi-Fi but that was about the only negative point. The breakfast was simple but more than adequate and there are a number of good restaurants very close to the hotel which we really liked. Take the metro to Republica not Cavour, it is much easier to find the hotel a short walk along a major shopping street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Artorius”
Reviews.Author: roddyrhino
Reviews.Content: Room - Excellent, tastefully decorated, sufficent space,. Bathroom large and spacious. well planned out. Common areas very classy in a boutique fashion. High cleanliness standards. Breakfast- Continental- more than ample choice, regularly replenished. Location-Superb -For Metro-Colesseum-quality Restaurants too. Staff-Very polite. friendly and helpful. We had a superb first visit to Rome. Yes OK the lovely weather helped. The visit was one of our most enjoyable in over 31 years of Worldwide travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Vaughn R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location - we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Metro is only 10 minutes away if you do want to go somewhere else. We had two rooms and rooms were comfortable and staff was pleasant and helpful. Could not beat this property for value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Millie E
Reviews.Content: Well appointed room. Spacious considering the location and cost. The room was clean, comfortable and very welcoming. The situation of the hotel could not have been better. It was within walking distance of many tourist attractions with the added plus of being close to the underground when walking no longer felt like an option. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. If I returned to Rome, I would definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet. Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: communicator1598
Reviews.Content: Fully modern rooms well situated to all Rome has to offer. While the lobby and the garden is on the main level, the rooms are situated on the upper floors. There is an elevator available, but the reception needs to provide access. The room was spacious, nicely appointed, with a full modern bathroom. Air conditioning was welcome. The reception staff was helpful in guiding us to points of interest, and in finding local services such as a laundry service. The continental breakfast in the garden was an ideal way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, perfect for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: danny_robbo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Artorius for 3 nights over new year 2011/2012. The hotel itself is small but well appointed and the room we had was perfect for our needs (site seeing break). Our room was a double which was nicely decorated and furnished, and was a good size considering we were in the centre of Rome. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, spoke excellent English, and humoured my awful Italian! :) The location of the hotel is brilliant as it's only about 500 metres from the Colosseum. We walked to the hotel from the central Termini on arrival but the hotel has two Metro stops very close by (Cavour which is practically on the same road as the hotel, and the Colosseum stop which is at the end of the road parallel) which makes it easilly accessible to anyone who doesn't want to walk with their luggage. The entrance to the hotel is on the street and looked very pretty with the christmas decorations up outside. The hotel was an excellent starting point to the city and we found most locations were walkable (given a good hike) although you had the handiness of the Metro nearby if your feet started to ache. There were also a good range of restaurants on the same street as the hotel. We ate at 3 of them whilst we were there and they were all very nice. We didn't make it for breakfast on any of the days so I can't comment on that, but we would go back to this hotel in a flash when we return to Rome due to how welcome we were made to feel, the amenities the hotel provides for the cost, and it's superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Breakfast, Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CA_sisterbelle
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor after many searches. We can't say enough about this place. You can walk to many sites from this location. The breakfast must be the best in all of Rome. We looked forward eveyday to start our day off with the wonderful buffet. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are very comfortable, and the bathroom is large with nice shower area. Close to a wonderful restaurant we went to every night for dinner, and loved. We did not want to leave this quaint little hotel. We will go back to this lovely place when we are in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Fantastic Breakfast, Brilliant Staff, Great Rooms, Good Value....Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CityExplorer101
Reviews.Content: After much research on Trip Advisor I stayed here for 3 nights in late August. It was the most perfect stay. From the moment we walked in, tired, hot and dishevelled, the welcoming was warm, friendly and helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location, only a few minutes walk from all the sights, restaurants and shops. It makes a fantastic base to explore the city from, even being a reasonable walking distance from Vatican City, which was the furthest point we ventured to. It is set back on a quiet street, in a deceptively plain building. As soon as you enter though, it is very grand and majestic. There is a small supermarket across the road which was useful for bits and pieces. The service from the staff was fantastic, they were always accommodating, meeting all our needs, speaking very good English, and willing to help and advise on days out, transport and other information. Breakfast was amazing, so much choice from pastries, to toast, to cereals, yoghurts, fruit, meats, cheeses....along with a fantastic cappuccino. Very Italian! The rooms were clean and of a good size, as was the bathroom. The mini bar in the room was very reasonably priced and the air conditioning was a god send. We had a balcony which was a nice extra and the room felt safe and secure. We did however have an air conditioning unit on the balcony, which although covered and not too monstrous to look at, was quite noisy. Due to the heat we slept with the air conditioning on though and it did not disturb sleep. I hope to return to Rome one day and I definitely plan to return to this hotel. I would recommend it as a fantastic place to stay, and say don't be deceived by the low star quality that travel agents may give it - it is purely because it does not have facilities such as a gym, restaurant, bar etc. It is very highly rated on Trip Advisor, and I can't fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, excellent location, fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Dollymox
Reviews.Content: Looked at lots of hotels before settling in this one. The hotel is perfectly located for virtually everything you would want to visit in Rome - we only took the metro to the Vatican everywhere else we walked to. The reception is manned 24 hours and was very secure - the small street where the hotel is located us very quiet. The breakfast was really generous - loads in choice and quantities - and served til 10- really set u up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok B&B, just don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: AGVAUK
Reviews.Content: Having read some very favourable reviews on Tripadvisor, and the hotel's own description of itself as a "luxury"boutique hotel, we were distinctly taken aback to be shown into our "Junior Suite" and found it to be absolutely tiny. The bed was kingsize, admittedly , but there was about 18 inches of space on either side of it, with a table - complete with plastic flower arrangement - and an upright chair. A wardrobe with five hangers completed the furniture: there were no shelves or drawers so we lived out of our suitcase for five nights. The bathroom was also tiny, with only a shower and rather thin towels. Having said that, the breakfast was ok, the location is good, the blonde on reception was pretty surly but the other staff (the owners?) we're fine. If I'd wanted a cheap and cheerful B&B, this would have been perfect...but my student days are long behind me, and I want a little more luxury these days. And the internet only worked when you stood by the door!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean hotel, best location walking distance to everything.”
Reviews.Author: KPEOzzie
Reviews.Content: Best location, great rooms, comfy bed, excellent staff that were really helpful, they even made some bookings for us. Highly recommended!! Good hotel security and safe area. Delish cakes at breakfast and good coffee made to order

Reviews.Title: “As good as they all say it is!”
Reviews.Author: Dove C
Reviews.Content: Stylish little hotel. Very friendly helpful staff. Excellent location within 15 to 20 minutes walking distance of most of the major sights in a quiet but interesting little side-street with small supermarket ( few & far between) just opposite and several bistros/tavernas/restaurants in the vicinity as well as a handful of elegant boutiques. I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay October 29 and 30, 2011”
Reviews.Author: 2GeorgiaBrowns
Reviews.Content: We’ve just returned from two weeks in the Val d’ Orcia area of Tuscany. It was amazing as always. We ended our Italy trip by staying in Rome for two nights before flying home. We stayed, for the second year, at Hotel Artorius and were very pleased with our stay. The owner and his staff: Carla and Meemo did everything they could to make our stay pleasant. They printed our boarding passes for us and arranged a car to drive us to the airport. The breakfast room normally opens at 7:00 am. Our driver was picking us up at 5:45, so the owner had coffee for us at 5:00. It is very quiet and we felt very safe there. It is in a good location, Via del Boschetto, just off Via Nationale. There are restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The Hotel is within easy walking distance of the Colosseum, the Spanish steps, and Trevi fountain. We highly recommend Hotel Artorius. 2 Georgia Browns

Reviews.Title: “What More Can You Ask For”
Reviews.Author: zithelp
Reviews.Content: I have to give the Hotel 5 stars as for the price in this location it cannot be beat. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great location, rooms are large enough to be comfortable, and a good breafast to start the day! We only stayed one night as we were at the end of our trip heading home, and have toured Rome many times in the past. From our prior stays this Hotel was amoung the best. Reviewers are right that there are many good restaurants and shops nearby and you can walk to almost all sights from here. Is it the Best hotel we stayed in on our trip? No, but I also cannot find any faults to justify downgrading them and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good location good service”
Reviews.Author: Adam F
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, service was very good. There were some defects in the room, however it was clean and quiet. Price was a little expensive, but that is normal for this area.

Reviews.Title: “October 22th - 25th 2011”
Reviews.Author: jeff k
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this wonderful boutigue hotel. I researched the Internet for various levels of accomodation and was initially nervous at the 2* rating. I had been i vaious hotels the week before on business ad they were all 4* + but this little gem beat them all. We walked everywhere from this hotel except the Vatican and that was only 15 minutes away on the Metro. The rooms are immaculate and include free wi-fi and full sky TV. The reception is manned 24hrs and the staff were fantastic. The breakfast was excellent and can fill you up all day. Book with confidence when staying here you wont be dissapointed. Ignore the hotel rating and use tripadvisors reviews. Jeff & Helen, Yorkshire, UK

Reviews.Title: “Arrivederci Roma - Hope to see you soon!!”
Reviews.Author: Bike2Explore
Reviews.Content: Visiting Rome was a major highlight of our European vacation and staying at the Hotel Artorius was the perfect choice for our stay in Rome. Walking distance to many major attractions, safe, clean, comfortable and a very helpful friendly staff. This beautiful hotel will definitely see us as guests again. The hotel was highly recommended to us by friends and their advice did not disappoint. The Coliseum, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain were within walking distance and a short taxi ride took us to the smallest country in the world - The Vatican. Surrounding the hotel are beautiful shops and restaurants - ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Roman Refuge”
Reviews.Author: Clipper995
Reviews.Content: Delightful small hotel on a quiet side street. The location is superb. Perfect starting point for our walking tours. A short walk in one direction leads to the Coliseum and Forum, in another direction to Trevi Fountain, etc. Interesting restaurants and shops are nearby. Yet by being off the main traffic and shopping streets, it feels very relaxed, quite a blessing in Rome. The rooms are neat and clean with comfortable beds. Ours faced the rear and had a small outside sitting area, most welcoming on a warm evening. The staff was most courteous and helpful. The breakfast (included in our rate) was tasty and well presented. There were only 2 minor glitches. First, there is very little shelf or storage space, especially in the bathroom (which was otherwise roomy and pleasant). Second, the WiFI did not extend to our room at the end of the hall. The staff made efforts to adjust the range, but I found myself standing in the hallway to connect. A couple of tips. The fixed rate taxi service from the airport can' t be beat. Much quicker and more relaxing that taking the train in and finding a taxi at Termini station. Our taxi driver found the street easily, but had trouble finding the hotel. Go to something like Google Maps Street View before you visit to get a sense for the setting and what the entry looks like from the street. We were able to point out the hotel and avoid having to drive around the block a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Having decided to look for a hotel close to the main sightseeing attractions we booked the Hotel Artorius on the strength of its first rate Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Hotel Artorius will not provide the bells and whistles of resort hotels, but it is a clean, well maintained and quiet refuge in the middle of a frenetic city. The staff are without exception friendly and helpful, responding immediately to any requests or questions. Our room, furnished as a triple, was more than big enough for the two of us. Being at the back of the building we had the additional benefit of a good-sized balcony, a great place to sit at the end of the day while our feet throbbed! The courtyard breakfast area doubles as a bar on request. It is well worth using this facility as the prices compare very favourably with local bars and cafes. The hotel is surrounded by narrow cobbled streets full of bars and restaurants - visitors are spoilt for choice. We felt perfectly comfortable strolling around the area late in the evening, which is not something you can say about all parts of the city. We would have no hesitation in staying at Hotel Artorius again, or in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading about it o. Trip advisor and we were not disappointed. Tha hotel was within walking distance of the colluseum the roman forum. Great restaurants and and bars along the street. This hotel is in a quieter area of Rome a lot of locals live in this area. The hotel was great very clean, the rooms are cleaned daily, the breakfast is downstairs under a shady vine or you can eat inside. Breakfast was adequate with different options available with someone there to make your coffee when you walk in. Would definitely go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishEyesSA
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed it is an absolute gem - comfortable bed - room not large but we had our own private balcony - close to Via Nazionalle where a short walk gets you to the Metro and lots of buses - plenty of restaurants. the staff are very friendly and helpful and breakfast was good. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A safe haven in the heart of Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Receivelight
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went for an overnight trip to Roma from Firenze. We got to Roma very tired as we have been traveling for about 3 weeks. We walked around looking for a hotel that was clean, reasonably priced and safe for two women to walk late at night. We found Hotel Artorius and walked in. Not only the hotel was charming, but the staff were also extremely nice and helpful. The breakfast atrium was lovely, it was so lovely eating breakfast with grapes dangling from the grapevine covering the court yard. There was Wifi that actually worked in our room. The room was clean. It was a wonderful experience and a lovely place to stay. I would no doubt go back there again if I am ever in Roma :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jbmuss
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable find!!! Two blocks north of the colesium. In the midst of ristarantes, shopping, cafes,bars. A good place if you like to walk and explore. The room was spacious,clean, attractive and had a super bathroom. The staff was helpful and friendly. Free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Very good small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcardoso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I agree with other TA reviewers . This small hotel is very well located , close to many touristic places , to Via Nazionalle and to many good restaurants and the Cavour metro station . It is very clean and the service is great , Carla and Maurizzio are very kind and allways ready to help

Reviews.Title: “Great for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: doug4523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just one night, to get a little taste of Rome before our main stay in Positano. The hotel was nice, clean, and the breakfast in the morning was more then acceptable. I would stay again if we ever came back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, helpful staff, GREAT value”
Reviews.Author: Hmill82
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the great reviews on tripadvisor and the reasonable price. It has all the great reviews for a reason. When we first arrived, something had happened with our reservation, however, they were able to give us an even better room! The room was large and spacious, free wifi, and a working air conditioner was a plus. The bathroom was clean and much more room than other European hotels we have stayed at. The staff was wonderful to help us with whatever we needed. One of the great things about this place was the little grocery store on the street. We were able to pick up some cheap wine and snacks while and rest some in the late afternoon before we headed out for our evening plans. Breakfast is included each morning, however, it is nothing to brag about. Overall this place is a wonderful value and I would stay here if we go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved lovd this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PVP
Reviews.Content: We read the review and booked off of the comments from trip advisor. It has not been a dissapointment. We have been here a week and have a very large room with a wonderful large private balcony that seems more like an additional room. The location is great, we have ate at all different kinds of restaurants around the area and shopped at the grocery store across te street. We have done walking tours and rode both the train lines. The breakfast is good and the staff very friendly. One note is that when you leave for the day you leave your key with the front desk. We thought this odd at first but realize it is one less thing to keep track of and the security is great. It has been very hot it Italy but the rooms are cool and the showers hot. We just love this style of accomodations with the feeling of Italy. If you have any questions just ask the front desk. It is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Recommend”
Reviews.Author: AndyWidd
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to Rome's best attractions. Very nice and helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AlyNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day trip to Rome and stayed in the hotel Artorius after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. We could not rate the hotel highly enough and was excellent value for money. The hotel is situated 10 mins walk north of the Coliseum in a pretty side street close to many cafe's and restaurants and within easy walking distance of many of Rome's highlights. The superb metro system is only 10 mins walk away as well. The hotel does not look much from the outside but is of a very high standard inside. We had a double room which was a generous size, spotlesssly clean and had a smart bathroom. Our room also had a good size balcony although we never used as we were out most of the time exploring. The hotel has a small 24hr reception with really helpful staff who gave us lots of advice on where to go and how to get there. The highlight of this hotel is the breakfast which is served 7-10am in a little covered courtyard. The staff brought us a lovely cappucino whilst we helped ourself to the excellent breakfast buffet of cereal, croissants, danish and more. If you are looking for a smart hotel at a decent price in an excellent location then the Hotel Artorius is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel in an interesting location”
Reviews.Author: tridonald
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artorious was located within walking distance of the Colosseum as well as public transportation. The Hotel is small (really more like a Pension) with a wonderful breakfast and very very helpful staff. We managed to time our stay to coincide with a general transportation strike and the hotel staff was instrumental in getting us to the train station for our train to Venice. Our room was spacious by European standards and we were very comfortable. There were a number of very fine small restaurants on the same block as the hotel. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel, and wouldn't hesitate to come back.”
Reviews.Author: ILtraveler003
Reviews.Content: The location is very covenient, and we felt very secure and "at home" in the area. The staff was very helpful and professional. They made every effort to accomodate our needs and answer our questions. In fact, when we returned to Rome on the last night of our visit, we had already booked a hotel near the airport. We decided to cancel that reservation and return to the Artorius for our last night. They made arrangements for us to be taken to the airport the next morning. They made our last night in Rome hassle free. Rooms were very clean and the outside balcony we had the first three nights we stayed there was wonderful! When I return to Rome, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sdperkins728
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy and stayed at Hotel Artorius in Rome for our final two nights. I learned about the hotel from TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very well run, clean and quiet rooms with great bathrooms. Free breakfast in the small courtyard in the morning with an espresso bar open 24/7. Very centrally located, especially near the Colesseum.

Reviews.Title: “Charming introduction to historic section”
Reviews.Author: Therese50
Reviews.Content: We loved our first stop here for our Italy trip. This historic building has been renovated to accommodate the modern traveler in this boutique hotel. Our room for three included a balcony , tall windows, and an up-to-date tiled bathroom. The staff was extremely nice, especially with the continental breakfast set up in the cafe. We were surprised to find the Coliseum just a few blocks from our hotel, so the sightseeing begins as soon as you step out the front door into the narrow street. Air conditioning and wifi are included. The mattresses are too firm, but that was the only drawback for these first-time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl3
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I just spent 4 days in Rome and a highlight was this lovely hotel near the Colosseum. We had two adjacent rooms at the end of a secure hallway so we and our daughter felt safe and comfortable. Our double room was spacious if a little dark (only one smallish window) and the marble bathroom was beautifully appointed. The staff were gracious and accommodating and breakfast in the covered courtyard was plentiful. Plus, wi-fi access in the room was very helpful. We walked to many nearby sites and took public transport or a taxi to others. The location could not have been better. We would definitely stay here again if travels took us back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough....”
Reviews.Author: talton9
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Rooms are nice and air conditioned. Breakfast was excellent and served in the nicest little courtyard covered with grapevines. Ideal location - we walked everywhere we wanted to go - Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, restaraunts and gelato! Only needed a cab for the Vatican. Everyone at the Hotel was friendly and most helpful. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: FalcoG
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hotel and very happy to have chosen it from the Tripadvisor reviews. The street was beautiful, the room was great, the service very friendly and helpful, the breakfast great, very clean. The lift was a gem, the marble stairs....loved it! The boutiques next to the hotel had beautiful things!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dd753
Reviews.Content: We have just returned fro a trip to Italy, during which we spent 2 nights at the Hotel Artorius. It was the best hotel of our trip and was an absolute gem. It is located in a quiet backstreet, a few minutes away from the bussle of the main streets and 15 minutes walk to the Colosseum. There are loads of great little restaurants in the nearby streets, which are much better value for money than those around the tourist sights. The hotel itself was lovely. There is a nice courtyard which is used for breakfast and the rooms are a decent size and are well furnished. Best of all was the staff, who were extremely helpful and nice people - particularly Mimo who we spent a long time chatting to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: MCougars
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Arrived early on our arrival day and they allowed us to check in early. Front desk personnel are friendly and helpful (offer you suggestions on where to eat, let you borrow an umbrella if it's raining, etc). Free breakfast every morning- coffee/tea/cappucino/etc., cereals, yogurts, juices, fruit, pastries, breads. Quaint outdoor eating area. Location is wonderful. Very close to the Metro and is within walking distance of most sights (except Vatican City). Easy walk to Colosseum . We even walked at night to the Spanish Steps, Campo de Fiori, and the Trevi Fountain. No issues or concerns coming back late at night. The rooms are small (as we expected). Bathrooms are upgraded and clean, which was very important for us. Free wifi if you bring your own laptop. One drawback was that there was no safe. We loved it and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Positives Reviews - Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DottiG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased. Our room was spacious and clean with a lovely balcony. The staff were very friendly and helpful and there is a very good breakfast each morning. Also within walking distance of the Roman Forum and Colosseum. We would highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here our next trip to Romel

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: vadjar
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights after all this recommendations and we didn’t disappointed at all. Hotel is small but in good location which helps a lot specially when bus stop and Metro is close, rooms are large enough and clean, stuff are very friendly and helpful. One of the best part was the delicious breakfast every morning,we will definetely recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Jillmarsco
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and I would definitely go back. The room was small but had a lovely little patio. The bathroom was huge by European standards and very clean. They had a lovely breakfast room with lots of choice and really good Italian coffee. The staff were very helpful and had bus and metro tickets for sale at the front desk. Good location with a 10 minute walk to the Termini and the Coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “As someone else said, what a little Gem in the streets of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cokephaedra
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel purely on the reviews already written on tripadvisor. I would never chance it and stay in a 2* rated hotel, but I I trusted the many 5/5 reviews. We stayed three nights, the rooms were lovely, upholstered padded walls, high ceilings, beautiful curtain drapes etc and the marble bathroom was immaculate. I think the reason the hotel has such a low rating is the fact the breakfast room is in the small courtyard and like a soft conservatory but was very quaint. The breakfast was ample, fresh baked pastries, yoghurts, fruit, meats, salami etc and cheese. All run by the family members, who were so attentive and went out of their way to please. The luggage lift is a hundred years old, it was truly an Italian experience. 10-15 min walk to the Colosseum, in fact we walked to most of the major sites. Excellent restaurant next door, OSTERI AL 16, not a tourist in site. Small supermaket just opposite hidden, blink and you will miss it. Thank you to all the reviews, we had a most memorable stay in Rome. www.airport-transfers-direct.com were excellent, 80 Euros return to and from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzlivo
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 children) and stayed here in March this year. We thouroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a triple room with a cot which was great. The breakfast staff were wonderful and prvided hot chocolates to the childrens delight each morning. THe hotel is in an excellent position and with 3 small children we walked to the colosseum and other attractions easily. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Nexus489
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel following positive reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. Very attentive and helpful staff; spotlessly clean; great breakfast ( super cappochinos) and even a small bar service. Highly recommended. It's also in an areas with a wealth of caves, bars and restaurants. Other tips: if there are 4 of you get a taxi into town, €40 and beats the train. The hotel will organise a chauffered service back to the airport for € 45. Takes all the stress of carrying your bags from train stations. Roma Pass - worth it just to walk by the long queues at the Collesium when you use their dedicated entrance. Don't buy any water, all the water points around Rome are drinkable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: h2oregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Artorius in October. It was a very enjoyable experience. The staff was great, the room was large enough and had some nice detail work. The location of the hotel is perfect. We were able to walk to most of the sites in Rome. It is also close to the metro and bus stops. There are lots of good restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great service ,great location”
Reviews.Author: macka093
Reviews.Content: We went in Rome in March and stayed in Arturios for 3 night .Although its a 2 star hotel we think it deserves more. The location is great .We walked to all the main attractions in Rome from the hotel Staff is very friendly and helpfull,Many nice restaurants close by Try LA CARBONARA and AL VINO AL VINO .Very nice litttle places

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Kakipants
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon. The hotel was very nice...nothing over the top but clean and roomy. We had a small porch off of our room which was very nice. The hotel was in excellent walking distance to so many restaurants and attractions. We loved the breakfast every morning....a great way to start off the day. It was a traditional European breakfast with bread, cheeses, meats....no typical "american" foods; but that was the charm. The staff was extremely helpful. The airlines had lost our luggage and Rome was our first stop on the honeymoon. THe staff called the airlines everyday for us to try to see when it would get there. You don't realize how hard it is to make arrangements like that when you don't have a phone or speak the language. With there help (and my Dad's via email) we received our luggage the night before we were moving on to our next destination. We would definately recommend this hotel!!! Great value for Rome as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent- lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: danepmills
Reviews.Content: Our decision to stay in the Hotel Artorius was strongly influenced by very good Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. It is a friendly, family run, hotel and this was reflected in the excellent service we received. We are a family of five and stayed for three nights in two rooms. The rooms were well appointed, spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was a continental style buffet with a reasonable selection of fruit juices, cereals, pastries, cakes, cheese, cold meat and bread. It was better than we had expected. The hotel is in an excellent location, with only a few minutes walk to most of the Ancient Roman sites. It is in a narrow, cobbled street which is busy but charming. There are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity and there is a small local supermarket directly opposite. We purchased some wine there and the hotel were happy to provide the corkscrew. We ate in three different restaurants, all within 100 metres of the hotel.The hotel were helpful in advising on the relative merits and prices of the local restaurantst. The meals were generally of a good standard at the places we chose to eat, athough the service was not as friendly as we would have hoped for. Maybe that was because we did not speak any Italian and the other diners were mainly locals. If we return to Rome we would definitely stay at the Artorius.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: kpshevock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Artorius for 8 nights. We were very satisfied with our entire experience. The staff was very helpful in reccomending various resteraunts to us. Several of our favorites were literally right down the street. They also helped us book reservations. The free breakfast was delightful everymorning. I loved being asked what type of fancy italian coffee I would like and then peruse the yummy pastries and try to make a healthier choice! We loved the location. It was walkable to everything that we wanted to go. On another note, we wanted to use the room to stay in and just relax and snuggle up and eat take out pizza and wine. We found great pizza and used the grocery store right across from the hotel to make this night come to life. THe direct tv with movie channels that can be changed to various languages were an added bonus for those nights! The maid service did a great job of cleaning our room based on our needs. I love the hotel! I thought they were great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and safe hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SeimenBurum
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel in the heart of Rome. You can walk from this hotel to all the main attractions. The hotel is very clean and safe and the rooms are very nicely decorated. You will see cleaning going on all day. Security cams are everywhere and there are multiple doors to pass, some with electronic keys, before you reach your room. The breakfast is good for Italian standards and again the staff keeps the area very clean. The staff is very kind and helpfull and can arrange bookings for museums, etc. Opposite the hotel is a small supermarket where you can buy snacks, drinks, etc. There is free WiFi internet but I used the fixed cabled connection which is also available in the rooms. The front desk has connection cables available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Simple, Clean”
Reviews.Author: keistie
Reviews.Content: It's a barebones hotel but very clean. Staff were friendly, price was right for what you get. Our room was facing the street and with the windows shut was fairly quiet. Breakfast was basic and fresh. Location was nice for sightseeing as several sights and public transport were a short walk away. My one complaint is there were no extra pillows in the room.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, stay at the Artorius.”
Reviews.Author: 17thousandkm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the other reviews and I was not dissappointed. The Hotel Artorius is in a fantastic location just off the Via Nationale and close to many of Rome's historical sights. Unfortunately I arrived in Rome feeling lousy with a chest-cold and no luggage (thanks to Alitalia), but I received a warm welcome and my room was well appointed. I spent of lot of time resting in bed but being in such a great location meant I was able to experience a little of the city without having to venture far afield. There are a number of reasonably priced restaurants nearby, and a small supermarket opposite, so although the hotel doesn't have room-service I didn't have to go far to get meals and snacks. The room was spotlessly clean, with a sparkling marble bathroom including bidet, and a very reasonably priced minibar (no item cost more than $3.50 Euros). The telephone calls I made to Alitalia about my luggage were also charged at very reasonable rates. I was a little suprised at the lack of English fluency amongst the staff, however they were all very helpful, courteous and cheerful. The breakfast included in the room rate was continental only but included a wide array of cold meat, cheeses, yogurts, fruit, cereal and some delicious looking pastries. The housekeeping at Hotel Artorius was very efficient however after a couple of days I realised my sheets weren't being changed each day. One other minor hassle was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however I think this is pretty standard in Europe. I used the free wireless internet and it wasn't super-fast, but fine for checking email and general web-surfing. There is access to cabled-internet too which I was told is faster. I hope to return to Rome one day, hopefully in better health, and when I do I'll definitely stay at Hotel Artorius.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for seeing Rome.............”
Reviews.Author: originallibertine
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Rome, and I selected this hotel from T.A. Location- positvley excellent, a few minutes walk to the colloseum and ancient forums. on a quiet , cobbled side road off the Via Nazionale - a busy bustling boulevard. lots of lovely little restaurants with Roman specialities. Service - reception staff/breakfast staff all very helpful. Nothinhg is too much trouble.They provide the best map of rome I found - free. Cleanliness - couldn't be better. Rooms - small , but generous in comparison to other european cities. Bathrroom immaculate.Could.ve done with more drawer space - my only criticism. Excellent double glazing.Nice towels.Good mini-bar with reasonable prices. Value- pretty good.Breakfast in the gazebo out back nice and varied. Great cappucino. We had a fantastic time in Rome-sightseeing naturally, and this hotel was perfect for that.I have already recommended this to friends, and when we return to do the bits we didnt get round to we would definatley return to Artorius.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: miss_duncan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend October 2010. Lovely staff, great location and the cleanest place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to Hotel Artorious”
Reviews.Author: Poushie
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 amazing days in Rome in November which was made more special by choosing to stay at Hotel Artorious. Our previous holiday in Rome 2 years ago we chose to stay in the heart of the Spanish steps but felt there were too many restaurants and cafes around us charging high tourist prices for food and coffee After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we chose to book Hotel Artorious and were not disappointed with the location which was in easy walk to all the sightseeing and especially for the tram and train station. The room was spacious for European standards and we loved the feeling of being in a little cobbled street off the main Via Nazioinale and with plenty of local restaurants nearby. The local restaurant recommeded by the hotel just around the corner provided excellent local Roman food which is what we had been looking for on previous trips to Rome but at half the price. The hotel breakfast which was included in the room rate was excellent. There really was not much we could fault with our stay and we are thankful to the staff for looking after us during our 3 days and look forward to another weekender in Rome in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of Rome....”
Reviews.Author: srogl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in a fabulous area. I stayed here 4 years ago and was thrilled to be able to stay here again. Hotel Artorius is a small, cozy, charming hotel with an extraordinary staff. Their recommendations for restaurants were great. The breakfast area is wonderful, even in the rain. I would strongly recommend The Hotel Artorius to anyone planning a trip to Rome. I look forward to staying there again.....hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ConradDC
Reviews.Content: To be sure, the Hotel Artorius is unpretentious and unprepossessing. But it's in a neat part of Rome, between Termini and the major tourist sites (most of which are readily walkable) and on the side streets immediately about you can get a real flavor of (non-touristy) Rome which is a true delight. The rooms are modest but serviceable and comfortable, as well we reasonably priced. We slept like babes. But it's the main floor which really shines, not least because of the friendly, personable, and helpful staff. What a pleasure it was to interact with them at every juncture. You get the feeling they actually like their work! Last but not least, the breakfast conservatory was beautiful. Just remembering it brings a smile to my face. But then, that's true of the Hotel Artorius in every way.

Reviews.Title: “A great find thanks to Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: mr_ed76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Rome where we spent three nights at the Hotel Artorius. It really is hard to find anything negative to say about this hotel from our experience. The most important things for us are a clean room and friendly staff. We were not disappointed. We were made to feel welcome upon arrival, were even shown to our room and given a street map of Rome. The room was spotlessly clean thankfully and even got the thumbs up from my wife, which is a compliment to the cleaning staff in itself. The bathroom was also clean and supplied with small bottles of shower gel/shampoo, body lotion, a shower cap, soap and two plastic cups (sealed in plastic wrapping). There were plenty of towels too which were replaced every day. The shower was fine: good pressure, easy to control temperature and shower head detachable from the wall. There was a mini-bar in the room and although we didn't use it, there was a price list on the desk and the prices were very reasonable, eg. one euro for a bottle of water. There is a LCD TV with a Sky satellite box mounted on the wall. Obviously most channels are in Italian but there were some English language channels such as Sky News and BBC World News. A good selection of music channels were available too. Films could be purchased for €5 - €8. We had a room on the first floor overlooking the street directly opposite the Teatro Manhattan. We were not bothered by noise, the street does not have too much traffic and during the night it was quiet. The windows do a good job of keeping any street noise down as you will realise if you open the window. As we stayed in November we did not need to use the air-con in the room, so I can't comment on how effective it is. As for breakfast, it was fine for us though I suspect it may not be enough for some people. There was a choice of croissants of various flavours, fruit juices, cereals, biscuits, cakes, bread and a toasting machine, some meats and cheese. A selection of fruit/herbal teas were available or the staff would bring you a hot drink if you wanted. The breakfast area was nicely laid out and welcoming. The location is good, a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum and less than that to the Cavour Metro station. There a quite a few restaurants in the immediate area. After checking out we were able to leave our bags in a secure storage area for a few hours before heading off for the airport. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel. Having read a lot of Trip Advisor reviews of lots of Rome hotels I'm glad we chose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Helpful, Safe, Quaint, Quiet, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Roamer616
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my two-day stay very much. Only drawback was my room was on the first floor above the cafe and at around 7:00 each morning, I was awakened by the banging sound of coffee grounds being slammed against something to tamp them down. Otherwise, a completely lovely experience and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - Extremely happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: TheMediaMan
Reviews.Content: For those that like a review in as few words as possible...Would we stay with Hotel Artorius again? Would we stay longer? We're we pleased with the location, hotel and staff? Absolutley yes! The reviews of Hotel Artorius are correct. We chose this hotel because of the reviews and we were not disappointed. Hotel Artorius is small, family run hotel that is situated on a side street just off Via Nazionale. It is a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and centrally located to all the major sights of Rome. The hotel is very clean and the rooms, albeit just slightly smaller compared to North American expectations, are well appointed and modern. It is an extremely well kept hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. Actually...the staff are great. You are staying in a warm, inviting and family hotel and that makes it feel different from a major chain. We felt comfortable, welcome and, in a way, part of the family. You always got a smile and friendly greeting whenever you left for the day and returned. The hotel includes a European breakfast (no ham and eggs for those of you looking for North American style of breakfast). The breakfast features a good, fresh assortment of cereals, pastries, cheese and meats, fresh juices, fruit and they make wonderful cappuccino. As a tourist this hotel is in a very good location. It is, more or less, central to all the major sights of Rome. It is a 10 minute walk from the Metro which we took to the Vatican but then walked back to the hotel seeing sights such as the Spanish Steps, Tevi Fountain, Plaza Navona and a host of other memories along the way. You have to walk a lot in Rome...it's the only way to really see the city and see all the things you'd miss on a bus tour or cab ride. Can you see all the major sights of Rome in 2 days? We did and didn't have to really rush....but to truly appreciate Rome do as we will the next time we visit Rome. We will stay with Hotel Artorius again but for at least 3-4 days. That allows more time to really slow down, soak in the atmosphere that is Rome and take more time at the major sights such as the Vatican Museum. Yes you can get a good overview of the Vatican museum in 3 hours but really...you need 5 or 6 hours for a good visit. (for those Museum junkies...a couple of days to see every nook and cranny and pause to appreicate all that the Museum has to offer). A helpful hint for English speaking tourists; try to learn a few phrases in Italian. We found that most people do speak at least a little bit of English but it is appreciated by the locals if you make whatever effort you can to speak a few phrases of Italian. It shows that you are making an effort to be courteous and that courtesy is often returned. We are tourists in their country so make the effort to be a good tourist.

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA40Love
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior and 2 nights after our cruise. The rooms are much larger than they appear on the website, nicely furnished with beautiful marble bathrooms. Some rooms have a private terrace which is great for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing before going out to dinner. The hotel is within walking distance to almost all major attractions including the Vatican (45 mins.). The rate includes a very nice continental type breakfast served in a lovely terrace room just off the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and restaurants in the area. There are probably a dozen or more restaurants located right on the same street and a handy supermarket right across the street. All in all we loved this hotel and I can't say enough nice things about Hotel Artorius that haven't already been said. We thouroughly enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a very nice hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: gridlock_10
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and welcoming. Hotel is spotless, rooms tasteful and comfortable. Excellent location as a base for exploring most sight including the Colosseum, forum and trevi fountain. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougbonnar
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel mainly because of the reviews on tripadvisor. There was nothing to complain about, the room was large and comfortable (overlooking the street but not noisy), the service efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: VATravlnPair
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Italy vacation and could not have been more pleased with Hotel Artorius. We arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight. The hotel provided us with a room to change and freshen up, and stored our luggage until check in. The hotel is located within a short walk to the main sites, which is very convenient. Rooms are spacious for a city, clean and have modern bathrooms. Breakfast is a full assortment of meats, cheeses, fruits and pastries, and the cappuccinos were delicious. Many thanks to Alesandro who assisted us upon arrival, and with a taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not so...”
Reviews.Author: VeszpremPeter
Reviews.Content: We choose the hotel after reading the reviews. Cca. 7 months before I booked it after changing mails with Luca and Alessandro, and the reason of the early-booking was a promise: we get a room with balcony, and not the room with the motor of the A/C unit directly on the balcony. When arrived, we got a double without balcony...I showed the mails to Mimo at the reception - finally we got the balcony-room w i t h the very loud A/C - motor. I can't propose it to anyone. Really not too easy to understand why was it necessary to promise the "normal" room and only because of that book it so early. That's it. The hotel itself is good, has a special, charming feeling, good breakfast, and the staff - except the process written above - is friendly, helpful. I booked a transfer from and to the airport: they arranged it perfectly. The best thing about the hotel is the location, very central, close to everything by foot. I would recommend it - in the case you'll get a room you've been promised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Tripmama18
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! It was our first time to Rome and we stayed 2 nights out of our 2 week Italy vacation. The room was very good sized, with a large beautiful bathroom and a private patio where my husband could play guitar when we returned at night from our roaming the town. The hotel arranged a taxi to meet us at the airport and, after a long flight from LA, we were met by a charming Italian lady who drove us to the hotel in a new silver Mercedes. Some taxi! It was worth the 50 Euros. The staff at the hotel, especially the owner's son, who was very charming and sweet, were so friendly and helpful with every single thing we needed, and I think we needed a lot. A cool place to visit is San Clemente church, with wonderful mosaics and excavations to a 1st century church underneath the current church. Buy your tickets ahead of time for the Sistine Chapel and you will not have a wait to get in. It's lovely, not only the chapel but the entire way there, through beautiful halls with statues and lots of art. The hotel is in a great location, close to everything, we walked everywhere and only took the metro to the Vatican. Savor it all, for Rome is truly a magical place, well, yes a little packed with tourists, but all of Italy seemed to be full of tourists. This hotel is a fantastic place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artorius was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: valaral
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome for 2 days after 11 days in Tuscany, and were ready for some sights! Hotel Artorius was perfectly located for our exploration; we arrived by noon and our rooms were already available; very nicely appointed, comfortable, and the staff could not have been more accomodating. After two glorious days of seeing the ciy, we had an early (6:00 a.m) taxi scheduled for our departure. The wonderful concierge offered to make us cappuccinos prior to our departure at 5:30 a.m., even though the breakfast did not START until 7:30 a.m.! What a treat! We would definitely recommend this place to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, but clean. Nice private patio”
Reviews.Author: spf1268
Reviews.Content: Very small tiny room, but had a charming little private patio outside. Nice clean and modern bathroom. Good breakfast in the main outdoor patio. No internet service, but had Sky TV with some english language TV channels. Close to a mini-market, local public transit, and the major sites. Decent value for the money, but would not stay here for more than 2-3 nights in one stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good value and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Christine P
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Artorius at the end of August and had a really good time. The first good thing about Hotel Artorius is certainly its location. It is located on a small and quiet street, but it is close to many of Rome's main sites and of two subway stations. It is also close to Termini train sation, which makes the commute to other cities easy. The room are well insonorated, so we slept very well. We had a double room, which was bigger than I expected. The bathroom was beautiful! The room a very clean. Breakfast was good and plentiful. It is served in the inner garden of the hotel, a cute and nice spot. We highly appreciated all the staff of the hotel. They were very friendly, spoke a good english, always had a smile on their face and always answered our questions! We felt at home. A big thank you to all of them. All of this came at a very reasonable price! Rome is a fantastic city to visit. Hotel Artorius made our stay even better because we knew we had a good, friendly and safe place to come back at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BarbNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights post-cruise at the Hotel Artorius. I made my choice based on reviews here on Trip Advisor and on venere.com. We were not disappointed. The hotel is comfortable, lovely and extremely clean. Bathrooms are beautiful. Mimmo and Maurizio were wonderful, so kind, friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful, within walking distance of many sights. A little market is directly across the street and there are a number of small lovely resturants on the street. You don't even know they are restaurants until they open their doors in the evening. They are patronized by the locals which is always a good sign. We ate right on the stree all three nights of our stay, twice in the hotel recommended La Taverna dei Monti. It was great and we received wonderful service from Silvia and Anohea.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJP1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the end of August. My double room was great, good size, nice bathroon with a lovely balcony. The only problem I had with the room was the noisy air conditioning and the loud generator located on the balcony (110) albeit cleverly disguised. I'm a light sleeper so I have to say because of this I did not have restful nights even though I was exhausted from hours of sightseeing. I knew that the hotel was full so I didn't ask for a room change. On the postive side the hotel is in a fantastic location for all the sites I even walked to the Vatican and back! The staff were all so friendly and I felt very comfortable/safe ( as a single traveller) staying in the hotel. I would definately stay at the Artorious again but in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “They treated us very well even though they had to move us elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DOK1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they told us that there was a problem with the plumbing in our room, and that they were fully booked, so they had to take us to another hotel. We were very disappointed after having read such glowing reviews. However, it all worked out really well. The other hotel - Hotel Apollo - was only steps away and was a very nice hotel, very much as the Hotel Artorius had been described. I was apprehensive that there would be some confusion over the payment, as we had prepaid through Hotels.com. However, there was absolutely no problem. This is a very good neighborhood for American tourists. It is close to many of the sights, but is in a relatively quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel close to attractions!”
Reviews.Author: purpledawn2
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with beautiful rooms (the pictures do not do it justice). The all-marble bathrooms are exquisite as well as the very clean rooms with fabric walls and beautiful crown molding. The small balcony was an added plus. We only stayed here one night as our main stay was in Florence, but the location was ideal. Five minute walk from blue line Metro, 10 minute walk to Coliseum, 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. Exceptional hotel. Continental breakfast was great, staff was so friendly and helpful. A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a city break”
Reviews.Author: tanabanana87
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It's a small hotel, down a side street, so away from the hustle and bustle noise of tourists, yet a short walk to get to the main attractions. The rooms are HUGE, ours had sound proofing and an outdoor terrace which was fantastic in the evening as we could grab a bottle of wine and enjoy on the terrace. Beware of the pillows though, I had ringing ears and a splitting headache in the morning of both nights that we stayed. The hotel staff were great, breakfast was ok (just rolls and pastries, and cereal). I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific small hotel close to attractions, but located in lovely residential area.”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelsoon
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Hotel Artorius in late June, 2010. This is a small family run hotel located within walking distance to many of Rome's attractions, including the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. Hotel Artorius is situated in the Monti section of Rome, which is a lovely residential neighborhood filled with small restaurants, and shops. At the end of the one of the local streets, we could see the Colosseum. The individual hotel rooms are charming, well decorated and clean. Our room had a small balcony, and the large tiled bathroom had beautiful fixtures. The hotel is family owned, and I must say that we enjoyed their hospitality. The hotel staff made dinner reservations for us, and great capuccino! I think its best to take a cab or use public transit to visit the Vatican, or to eat dinner near Piazza Navona at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ACG85
Reviews.Content: Close to the Colosseum, buses, and taxis, this small hotel on a quiet side street is a wonderful base from which to explore Rome. The staff is very helpful, breakfast is great, and the hotel is charming - from the old fashioned elevator to the beautiful wooden doors. Our room was very nice, and the bathroom looked new. We are in our 40s and have traveled widely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Phenomenal Staff, Perfect Neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: ALANandYAMILE
Reviews.Content: The folks at Hotel Artorius were so helpful. Before my wife and I traveled to Rome, we called the hotel and emailed them many times with a lot of questions and every time they took the time to address all our concerns. During our stay they helped us with tours and train reservations. The hotel is family owned and operated and that makes a big difference. The location is perfect, just outside of all the noisy/touristy areas. We liked everything about the hotel: the breakfast, our room, the location, the staff. Great place to stay. Alan, Florida, USA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful atmosphere, relaxed, secure and charming!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl5088
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at large hotels, so was concerned about staying somewhere so small and unknown. But no need to worry! Perfect place! Stayed here for one night pre-cruise. Ideal location, just a 5 minute walk to Colosseum. Great restaurants nearby. Area safe. Good security/locks/cameras at hotel as well. Very helpful staff who arranged transportation from airport and to cruise port, quickly whisked luggage up to our rooms, provided detailed directions and maps to all sites. Happily stored luggage the next morning while we toured. Breakfast area, rooms and hotel incredibly charming, much nicer than photos! Bed was comfortable, bathroom beautiful! Easy walk to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps. Took metro to Vatican City (stop about 10 minute walk from hotel) Could not have found a better place! Paid less than most other hotels in area. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a friend's home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dzharbert
Reviews.Content: My wife, 15 yr old daughter and I spent a wonderful 6 nights at Hotel Artorius. It felt like we were staying with family friends. The staff was wonderful, knowledgeable, helpful and always friendly. The food and service at breakfast was great as was the outdoor dining area. We often made the 10 minute walk to the forum area but always looked forward to our return to the sparkling clean hotel. I can't imagine a better small hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The top class hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dashaf
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here for 5 nights in summer 2010 together with my family - absolutely-absolutely happy about it! During our trip we have stayed in about 6 different hotels in different cities and countries. And this one my family and I always remember with warmth in our hearts. Every evening we would come back here as if it was our home. Room is spacious, very-very comfortable beds. Our room (109) even had a balcony, where you can have a late dinner. Bathroom is amazing, not too big, but sooo cozy. With everything you might possibly need. I just wanted to spend hours there - it was so comfortable and beautiful. Staff is a separate conversation! Everyone is friendly, especially people serving breakfest. They just light you with positive emotions in the beginning of the day. And one of the reception girls spoke Russian, which was very helpful for us! Location is also nice. You're in a walking distance to almsot everything - Coliseum especially :), close to bus stop and tube stop. There are endless little restaurants and cafes. The street is very cosy. Can't say a single bad word about this hotel. Absolutely enjoyed our visit. Would definitely stay there again. Can recommend to anyone. Big-big thank you to everyone working in Artorius.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon206
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at three hotels/B&Bs during this trip to Italy and Hotel Artorius was our favorite. The location was quiet and convenient for walking to the Colosseum, Palatine Hill, etc. There were several good restaurants nearby as well. We'd been concerned that it might be a bit off the beaten path when looking at maps prior to our stay there. While there aren't as many things to do in that area as there are in the Piazza Navona neighborhood, it was much livelier and offered more within easy walking distance than we expected. The relative quiet in noisy Rome and the great, family feel of the hotel made up for it being a little farther from some of the other popular areas. It also cost us less than our stay on the other side of town. The hotel was clean, beautifully decorated and our room (a double) was large by European standards. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast had good options and was a good value. Our only "negatives" are minor. The shower temperature didn't remain consistent and the room was a little darker than we would have liked. That was great on our first night in the city as we slept for about 12 hours straight after the long flight but it was a little gloomy for reading, putting on make up and such. We'd definitely stay there again when in Rome! Hotel Artorius is perfect for those looking for a cross between a B&B and a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay again if visiting Rome.”
Reviews.Author: silvershorts
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on strength of TA reviews and loved it - no complaints really, although I think it is a little overpriced and did not think the breakfast was that great. However, staff and service was very friendly and helpful, I liked the decor, location, and security of the hotel and there are lots of good restaurants and sites nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect center city hotel”
Reviews.Author: WimLeuven
Reviews.Content: On a quick visit to the Caravagio exhibition in Rome we looked for a close by center city hotel with good reviews and booked it trough booking.com. We hit the jackpot with a great service, very friendly staff, well located and spotless clean hotel and good breakfast. Loved everything about it. We had a bit of problem with our bill being debeted twice from our credit card but it was solved within a few days, so very correct. Will go again for sure when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Reservation System!!”
Reviews.Author: aldalebr
Reviews.Content: This has been the most difficult Trip Advisor review we've done about our recent trip to Italy. While we initially liked this hotel very much, we departed with an angry attitude about the hotel's very poor reservation system. To start with, we made internet reservations in late February for a 3-night stay at the end of April. Due to their reservation set-up, there was no immediate computer-generated reply to us with information as to dates of stay, room type and rates, and confirmation number. Because of this, we were a little uncertain if it went through. A few days later, we received an email from the hotel that was not readable---it was full of symbols with a few scattered sentences. We wrote back that we could not read it, and asked for a confirmation of our stay. The prompt response stated that we were confirmed for the requested dates. We wrote back again, asking about a confirmation number, but they replied there wasn't one. We crossed our fingers and hoped the room would be waiting for us when we arrived, which it thankfully was. The hotel is located in a very convenient location, within walking distance to many of the historical sites in Rome. It is located on a narrow side street that has several restaurants and a market. Although we were able to locate the place, the entrance is not easily distinguished from the other businesses on the street so you need to keep a close eye out for it. The hotel is very nicely decorated, clean, and our room had all the necessary amenities. Loved the old-time elevator, quite charming---and it worked, too! The outdoor, partially-covered breakfast room was lovely and the buffet was ample and delicious. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful with arranging airport transportation and providing ideas for restaurants. When it came time to check out, we were once again confronted with the realities of their reservation system. We were shocked to see that our daily room rate had increased from the quoted reservation rate---120 Euros/night---to 175 Euros/night! We were told that the lower rate was the fee for February (when we made the reservation), but the higher amount was the fee charged in April. This higher rate was not mentioned on the web site when the reservation was made; the only fee mentioned was the lower one. In all of the years we have traveled to numerous hotels, we have never encountered a hotel reservation system that quotes you a rate based on when you make the reservation, as opposed to when you will actually be staying there. This is extremely deceptive and is a very questionable business practice. The hotel refused to accept the rate we were quoted at the time of the reservation, and charged us the higher fee. Since they did not issue a confirmation receipt at the time we made the reservation, there was no paper trail that detailed what we signed up for. As stated earlier, we liked the hotel and location very much, so it is sad to say that we cannot recommend it to anyone else, or that we would stay there again. We sincerely hope that they modernize their reservation system so that it is reliable and provides accurate, honest information to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mFeatherst1
Reviews.Content: I'd almost like to keep this hotel a secret, but it's far to late for that. Our room was well appointed and immaculate. The service was always good, and we especially enjoyed the continental breakfasts. The desk attendants gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants and transportation back to the airport. And you have to see the elevator... it is straight out of a movie! The location was perfect for us, and there must have been fifteen nice little restaurants within easy walking distance. We're returning again next spring... assuming we can book a room!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient and great location”
Reviews.Author: Diotima03
Reviews.Content: So happy we chose this hotel. The staff were all so helpful. Our room was bigger than we had hoped and we had a terrace which was private. Across the street there is a small deli that we would buy cold cuts, bread, olives, wine and eat a cozy lunch on the terrace or pack with us. I would definitely stay here again. I will miss it! Janet

Reviews.Title: “great location, price, and service”
Reviews.Author: mabianchi
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky traveler ant this place was great even if it rained 2 of the 3 days I was there, but I didn't let that put a damper on my stay. I stayed for a long weekend in a single. The room was actually bigger than in the photos I had seen. I didn't hear anything in the next rooms. The hotel was sold out and the room right next to me I couldn't even hear a peep. It was in a great location on a side street. Around the corner was the metro and the Colloseo was a nice 5 minute walk if walked slowly. The breakfast was good. The service was great. I walked eveywhere (Colleseo, Trevi Fountain, Panthenon). I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful booking this place!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel May 3 online at venere.com, and got an email the same day confirming my reservation with a confirmation number. On May 4 while away on business, I got an email stating they had overbooked, asked me to cancel, and said they could book me in a B & B in the same building. I replied May 8, cancelling and asking to be booked into the B & B. I got an email this morning with the following"We confirm you that your reservation is cancelled at the Hotel Artorius from 17th to 20th June 2010 for 1 double rooms). Thank you very much for the interest shown in our Property and we really hope we can accommodate you in the future. Alessandro Hotel Artorius ( Roma )" I have emailed back asking about the B & B reservation and no reply yet. Looks like I'm not the only one who has experienced this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MoandLisa
