Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via Trip Advisor and can only add to the good reviews. The location is perfect, tucked away off the Via Nazionale, within walking distance of most of the major sights of this lovely City and with plenty of fine restaurants nearby, some of which were full of locals..which is always a good sign!. The room was spotlessly clean, fine bathroom and the breakfast was superb. The lovely old lift deserves a mention too!. The staff were very helpful, friendly and spoke excellent English. Where we go back to Rome, we'll be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find, one of the cleanest hotels around, and in the centre or Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Dickydick
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, in fact excellent trip. Myself and my wife enjoyed 3 nights in Rome and stayed at the Artorius Hotel. The hotel was lovely, it was located just a 10 minute walk from the main historical attractions, and right in the centre of the Rome. There were plenty of resturants just a stroll from the hotel, all of which were excellent and good value [you don't hear that much in Rome] I was told that it would be expensive, and to be fair for lunch it was, but then you're in a bar in the centre with all the tourists, we paid e55 for 3 beers a pizza and a bowl of chips, but we we're 300 yards from the Vatican. Seriously, try this one, the breakfast room is a summerhouse in the courtyard/garden which is lovely, and spotlessly clean, the rooms are clean and the shower fantastic, channel 500+ on the sky box will get you english channels, and the hotellier will give you guidance if you want it. There's a supermarket just opposite which sells everything you need. There is endless shops and all are great quality, there's all the brands and even a Jimmy Choo shop [so the wife tells me] Have a great trip and enjoy Rome

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel, delightful inside with kind staff, a good breakfast, and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: TomTom2097
Reviews.Content: ~Overall A lovely boutique hotel, delightful inside with kind staff, a good breakfast, and a great location. Fairly priced. ~Service The service was excellent. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, suggesting good local restaurants and giving us very useful advice on transport around the city. The room was well cleaned each day. Best of all, when our flight was cancelled at short notice, we were allowed to use the internet at the front desk to book an emergency flight back home. Please do not use our exceptional situation to expect free internet access - I mention this to give an indication of how kind and helpful the staff were. ~Bedroom Our room was not large, but a comfortable size for 3 nights, as we were spending most of the day out exploring the city. It was very nicely decorated - I can be quite fussy about this, but I was very impressed with the linen wall coverings, good lighting, storage, rich curtains and deep carpet. The bed was very comfortable, and we slept well. It was cold outside, but the room was always warm and inviting -. ~Bathroom In good condition - all the ceramics and fittings were very well chosen. It all worked perfectly and looked excellent. The shower was relatively large, with room to move. ~Breakfast There was a fair selection of pastries, coissants, cold meats, cereals and fruit. We were served with coffee, which was excellent. ~Location Very well located near major bus routes and within walking distance of the colosseum. We found it very convenient to explore the city, but only once we knew what the bus routes were. Our advice is to get a map that shows these clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lanchella
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfy and the staff were great - very helpful with our many queries. It is central to the main sights, we were able to walk everywhere - even to the Vatican City although it was a longer walk.

Reviews.Title: “Suprising Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filippo75
Reviews.Content: Very unusual hotel, but absolutely confortable and optimally located. The lobby area is actually one of the tiniest I've ever seen, but rooms are gorgeous and perfectly cleaned. It is located near Cavour and Colosseo, in a very nice (but quiet) area with lots of restaurants and bars. The only weak point is the breakfast area, very cold, but overall it's a great hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful taste of Rome”
Reviews.Author: pearl98
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights recently with our family of 5 -booked 2 rooms - both tasteful,spacious & very clean bathrooms -very gracious hosts-tasty breakfast included -would highly recommend this hotel to others looking for a more personal alternative to a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of time!”
Reviews.Author: nutshellKent
Reviews.Content: I've just wasted my time booking this hotel online, receiving a confirmation of my stay and then being informed there was no availability! If this is an impression of the service this hotel, I would suggest you don't bother booking!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the right place”
Reviews.Author: AnEnglishmanInGreece
Reviews.Content: I had less than a day in Rome between flights and chose this hotel because of the reviews here, its location and the good room rates. I was not disappointed. It is possible to get a non-stopping train (11 Euros) from the airport to the Terminus, and this is a manageable walk from the hotel, if you have a trustworthy map. There were plenty of taxis available also. The hotel is not imposing from the outside and I was standing right next to it before I realised I had found it. The reception staff were friendly and helpful; the hotel itself has a number of features that make it really secure - which given that my room did not have a safe, was encouraging. The double room I took was not very large but was very tastefully decorated with a bathroom that was big enough and functioned very efficiently. The bed must have been comfortable because I have no memory of it! The Colosseum was easy to find and about 8 minutes walk away. I asked for a recommendation for a local restaurant offering simple Roman food. There were two within about 100 metres, and the one I went to was simple and excellent. This hotel is fine for a two or three day visit - and the breakfast was very acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ThreeNightsinRome
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. The hotel entrance is understated and easy to walk by but the hotel is in a perfect location for most of the sites in Rome. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, and the breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: fadochicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artorius for 6 nights in early November and thought it was outstanding. We were able to check in mid morning when we arrived on Saturday. The staff was extremely friendly and able to answer all our questions. The hotel itself is located on a side street off of Via Nationale and very close (within a five minute walk) of both the Corso and Republica stops of the Metro. There are also several good restaurants within walking distance as well as a small grocery store right across the street where you can stock up on soda, snack items and other small things you may need. The room itself was nice, very clean and well maintained with hardly any outside noise from the side street below. We were on the first floor of the hotel, a level up from the check in. Overall this is a great hotel and we would stay there without hesitation if we were ever in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location --- Service, Service, Service”
Reviews.Author: Road_Maven
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel located on the 50 yard line in the historic district of Rome. Spotlessly clean, comfortable and convenient. We were able to check in at 9 AM after coming off of an 11 day cruise. The breakfast area was cheerful and the selection was good with something for everyone. My only small complaint was that if you had a room facing the front of the hotel, there was some street noise if you had the window open. However, it quieted down by bed time. They also have the coolest 100 year old elevator. You expect Sidney Greenstreet or Peter Lorre to come out when the door opens. We took it for a ride to the top floor, played around and briefly got stuck. The neighborood was safe and there were several small restaurants nearby. The metro was 7 or 8 blocks away but the bus was just around the corner. There was no request they couldn't handle. Needed an extra pillow? Got it right away. Needed a bathroom scale to check the weight of our luggage? Bingo. We were leaving early on Sunday, before the breakfast was served. They opened the breakfast room an hour early just to accomodate us. All this was done with a cheerful smile. When I visit Rome again? I will stay here and I suggest you do to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brighton9
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location in the Monti area right in the middle of Rome - you can walk to most of the sites. A 5 minute walk from Cavour metro station. It is in a narrow street and doesn't have a large sign so get directions from their website. Parking would be difficult. There are plenty of restaurants nearby but I wouldn't recommend the one two doors up the street. I paid €140 for a single room - it was quite small and old-style but perfectly adequate, had a good modern bathroom and even a small balcony overlooking the hotel's patio. The air conditioning was not very effective and the TV only had Italian channels. Everything was clean. Breakfast was continental but reasonable selection.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flygirl123
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Artorius. I was concerned that it wouldn't be very nice due to the pictures. This room doesn't photograph well, but the rooms are beautiful! They are huge, and the walls are fabric covered. The people who run this hotel are extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were delicious and ample, and the capuccino was delicious! This hotel is so much fancier and nicer than I'd expected. You will be lucky if you can book room here!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DAHR
Reviews.Content: The Artorius is a great, small hotel which offers very clean, comfortable and affordable accomodation. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it and would definitely consider here again. Rome is expensive and after reading piles of reviews of hotels where the rooms and bathrooms were miniscule, we were surprised by the very sizeable triple room we had, with a good sized private balcony. No view from our balcony of Room 109 but it was nice to have somewhere to sit quietly with a book. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very adequate and everything replenished very quickly if supplies ran low. We used the supermarket opposite to buy teabags and milk as there are no tea/coffee making facilities and the hotel staff were happy to supply us with hot water, teapot and cups whenever we asked. Beds were comfy, shower a bit tempremental but fine. All major attractions are within walkable distance and there are some very nice restaurants close by. We particularly liked Chicco di Grano, at 5-8 Via degli Zingari which is just minutes away, a very busy restaurant full of Italians which is always a good sign! Also enjoyed good food at Grillo Brillo which was much quieter. We had the hotel arrange a pick-up from the airport which cost 50 Euros. It worked well but I have to say the drivers in Rome are truly scarey. TWO mobile phones, taking and making calls, accelerating and braking hard, aggressive driving ... Be prepared! To return to the airport a few days later to pick up a hire car for the rest of our holiday, we asked the hotel to book us a taxi which cost 60 Euros. Not cheap! Unrelated to the hotel, there was an attraction we went to see that certainly wasn't the run of the mill tourist attraction. The Capuchin Crypt is located beneath Santa Maria della Concezione dei Cappuccini church on the Via Veneto near Piazza Barberini and consists of 5 little rooms decorated with skeletons and bones. It's totally bizarre, perhaps not suitable for all but it's really quite stunning and I'm quite sure I've seen nothing like it in my life, and probably never will. Entrance is by donation and if you happen to be in that area, it's well worth a look. I believe it's shut between 12-3pm. Back to the hotel. All in all this is a great hotel. It's not a big chain, so don't expect a lounge, uniformed staff or room service, but the location, rooms and service are great. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, ideal location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Stu_Coggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed for nights in last week of October with my wife and 20 month old son. Charming little hotel on a quiet street just off the via nationale. Very enjoyable stay, perfect location for most of the major sites, lots of nice little restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nw2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artorius for a week in early October. We had the hotel arrange for us to be picked up at the airport, well worth the price and peace of mind. The hotel is small and family owned and operated. It is located on a quiet side street, with many restaurants, shops, and a grocery store within a block or two. The hotel is a short walking distance from many attractions (the Vatican and the Borghese Gallery are a bit further), and public transportation is available right up the street. We stayed in a double room at the back of the hotel (102). The room was quiet, comfortable, and above all, both the room and hotel were spotless. Breakfast every morning, with an assortment of bread, meat, cheese, pastries, fruit, cereal, yogurt, tea and coffee (cappuccino, espresso) was a nice way to start the day. The intimate breakfast area was also a great place to unwind after hours. There was someone at the front desk 24 hours a day. The staff spoke English, were all very friendly and helpful, and the service was outstanding. We are looking forward to our next stay at the Artorius.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiGi365
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artorius for 3 days at the beginning of August and we absolutely loved everything about this hotel. We were a group of 7 family members/friends and we stayed in the triple room (#109). The room was big enough for 3 people with all the luggage. The room has a patio with a table and chairs which was great for the smokers in our group. The room was very clean and modern. The bathroom was also modern & had a big shower, even by American standards. The shower also had a clothesline in it & the blowdryer worked very well. For August, the air conditioning worked quite well. You need to keep your key in the holder by the door to keep the lights and air conditioning working in your room while you are in it. When you leave the hotel for touring, you leave the key at the front desk. We had no issues with this practice. A minibar is in the room with enough space to chill your own bottles of water. All the staff at the hotel spoke English very well & were always very helpful if you had any questions. You can even buy bus tickets at the lobby desk. Breakfast at the hotel was good - danishes, fresh fruit & juices. The hotel staff puts decorations on your cappucino which are cute! There is a small market directly across the street from hotel which we stopped at at least twice a day to pick up bottled water for touring & some snacks for the room. This was extremely convenient & a bonus for staying at this hotel. They sold everything there from toiletries to fresh sandwiches at the deli counter. They also had cheeses which were vacuum packaged to take back on a plane. There is a very good restaurant around the block from the hotel called Colonne. Its a small family run restaurant and the waitress spoke English. It was around 25 euro per person for the house wine, appetizer, salad, main dish, dessert & cappucino. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain & the Pantheon. If you are not into walking and want to conserve your energy, there is a bus stop right up the street. I would recommend the Artorius to anyone. It is a cute little hotel with a lot of charm & very helpful and cheerful staff. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indtraveler44
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our 15 day trip through Italy. Dropped our rental car off at the Hertz rental office and preceded to the taxi stop. We got the famous saying "TOO MUCH LUGGAGE!". Had to pull our luggage through Rome to find the hotel. So, if you rent a car, have the hotel arrange pick up for you, at the car drop off area. Luckily, we arrived at one of the best hotels of our trip! The Hotel Artorius had an elegance to it, even though it was not a large hotel. The service was impecable! They went way out of their way to make sure that you had a unforgetable stay. The rooms were very good in size and very clean. The outside terrace was a great place to enjoy a glass of wine after hours of sightseeing. They warm, blueberry croissant at breakfast were the best I ever had. The Trevi fountain is about a 10 minute walk, Collisium about 15 minutes. There are good restaurants and wine shops very close to the hotel, our favorite was the Al Giubileo. Great food and great service. The hotel arranged a cab to get us to the airport. Surprisingly, we didn't have, "TOO MUCH LUGGAGE!".

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: MarkAlbert31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artorius for a weekend in Rome. Shuttle from the Airport couldn't find it so we were a little concerned at first but no need. This is a little gem. Nice room, fantastic old lift. lovely breakfast room / bar area, very helpful & friendly staff. First time to Rome so don't know the area well, but this looks like an up & coming district. Really interesting shops, great bars & restaurants mostly frequented by locals, not crowded, and prices lower than in the more touristy areas. Great central location, we were able to walk to all the central attractions. One small thing - ask not to be put in the room with the main aircon unit on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fatnipples
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed that the Artorius from 8/28-9-1. This hotel was great. The staff all speaks perfect English which is great since I know very little Italian. They were extremely helpful with all our needs. The rooms were clean and need and big enough that we didnt feel cramped.The location honestly is perfect. It its pretty central to all the major sites and close to the bus stops. I have family in Rome and they were shocked that I knew to stay in this area. It's not in a super touristy area and you can go out and have drinks/coffee/food withough paying the astronomical tourist prices you find in and around the major piazzas. Without hesitation I would stay here everytime i go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankfitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: Short, 5 day, trip with my wife and found this to be a very good hotel. Very near main sites such as Forum, Palatine hill etc (10 minute easy walk) and plenty of very good eateries near by within walking distsnce. Try the wine bar down the street, turn left out the front door, which opens after about 7pm. It serves cold plates of food but has wonderfull wines and staff are extremely helpful. Also try Avanti De Avanti in the street which runs paralell to the hotel it is also excellent. Breakfasts are continental and excellent with very good teaa/coffee and all you need to set you up for the day. Hotel staff are also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: anniemina
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and we stayed at the Hotel Artorius for 2 nights before our cruise, and I cannot say enough about this hotel, the location, the service, and the cleanliness is better than staying in a large luxurious hotel, the coziness of the hotel, and the location is great, and it gives you some sort of real feeling of how Romans live. The staff is very helpfull, with anything that your needs, I will go back and stay there at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bostonfoodie-7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. The location was pretty convenient, pretty central to everything. The hotel itself wasn't bad, the bathrooms were modern and the size of the rooms were ok. We didn't have a terrace but didn't find it necessary for we were out all the time seeing the sights. The staff were ok. We felt that Allessandro was the only genuinely friendly person there. It helped to see him in the mornings. Lucca was ok but we didn't quite get much help with recommendations for restaurants, bars, etc. It was a good thing I did my research already so had some ideas to work off. Maybe it was because we were there at the end of August but we thought that there were more restaurant/bar options in other areas of Rome. A lot of places around the hotel were closed. Taking the tram was easy so not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman family experience”
Reviews.Author: Linsensuppe
Reviews.Content: Can't praise this hotel highly enough. It has real character and charm. It's location is perfect, close but not too close to the Colosseum and Ancient Rome, near quaint shops and wonderful cafes. The staff are all wonderfully helpful and kind and the breakfasts delicious. Give me this real Roman experience any time over a big impersonal hotel. I visited with my 16 year old daughter.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay - great location”
Reviews.Author: gwforceuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of August and were very impressed with the hotel. About a 15 walk from Termini station but would recommend using the metro to Cavour. The hotel is in a quiet side street within easy walking distance of the Colloseum and other major attractions. The room was very comfortable and clean with good air conditioning. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The area where breakfast is served is very comfortable and relaxing and the service was very good. Would defininately recommend for a short stay in this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LizEWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before a cruise in May. It was a fantastic pick. The room was a little small, but we don't spend much time in our room when we travel. The service was great, especially during breakfast. Make sure to get a cappuccino! The location is really close to the Colosseum too. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in central location”
Reviews.Author: kms4774
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and were very pleased with our choice. The staff catered to our every need (calling taxis, making restaurant reservations, etc.) and many sites were withing easy walking distance. Breakfast was above average. Room size was good (we had a triple), and the updated bathroom was a big plus. Bed were firm, by our usual standards, but we had no trouble sleeping. AC worked great, and sound proofing was excellent. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Astuteboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 4 nights in Mid-May. The first impressions of the Hotel were good as we arrived, although due to road works the taxi didn't drop us particularly near so we needed the map to find it. We just got a 40 Euro taxi from Fluminco Airport, but the central train station is not far away either. The staff were perfectly nice and spoke reasonable English. The room wasn’t huge, but perfectly adequate and clean. The bathroom was very nice for a hotel of this standard and was a good size also. It was 35C+ for the time we were there, but fortunately the air conditioning worked without any issues! The only down side was a noisy air conditioning unit right outside the window, but the window was sufficiently sound proofed to keep most of the noise out at night so it wasn't too bad. But in fairness to the hotel, in compensation for having a noisy unit right outside your window, you do get a roof terrace! I don't think any of the other rooms had a terrace from what I could see, and it was a really nice bonus to be able to sit outside with an ice cream after a long day hiking around before heading out in the evening. Location wise, the hotel is excellently situated for all the major attractions. The Vatican was a fair old trek considering the heat, particularly if you climb the Cupola as well as we did, but I'm not particularly fit and survived OK. You can always get a taxi I guess. The Borghese museum and gallery is also a fair old walk to the north, but again it's quite manageable from the hotel (whatever you do, don't miss it - it's not hard to see why they say it's the favourite museum for Romans today). There are many restaurants and bars nearby; finding somewhere nice to eat and drink isn't too difficult and I think everywhere we went had an English menu. There's also a mini-supermarket almost directly opposite the hotel which is very useful for stocking up on bottled water. Overall we had a really nice stay in this hotel and saw all the sights that we wanted to see, so no complaints at all really! I would definitely stay again if we went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Couldn't have asked for more!"”
Reviews.Author: Jake1980Chelmsford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the Via Nationale - though it is important to say it is at the better end of the Via Nationale towards the Via 4 Novembre! There are busses along this road that go all throughout the city including the Vatican but most sites are in easy walking distance from this Hotel. Via Del Boschetto has several places to eat, a small supermarket and a Gelataria at the bottom which is open late. It is a safe street, no beggars etc. and not very busy with traffic. The only hassle you get is from the waiters at the restaurants asking you to eat at their place but they are very polite. We definitely recommend the pizzeria on the corner of Via Del Boschetto and Via Degli Zingari, excellent food and good value for money but the wait for an outside seat can be long and the service a bit slow. We also recommend the Gelataria at the bottom of the road as the owner always has a smile on his face! The Hotel is small but amazingly clean when you walk in and the staff are very friendly, helpful and do speak English. They gave us a map on arrival which helped a lot! They also took our luggage up to our room while we took a quick walk around the area for half an hour. We were a little early for check in but this was OK. When we were shown to our room there were a bunch of flowers and a bottle of sparkling wine with chocolates waiting along with a note wishing us well on our honeymoon - very nice touch! The room was very clean and well furnished and tasteful with a double bed, bedside tables, desk with built in mini bar (very reasonably priced), chair, wardrobe and chest. All was in very good condition and of good quality. There was also a flat screen TV with satellite although I could only find one English channel but hey, you're in Rome so why watch TV!?!! We left it on as background noise in the morning. The bathroom was, again, very clean with a toilet, bidet, large sink and powerful shower. The room also had air conditioning with it's own control panel. Our room was at the back of the hotel and had a large private balcony - very nice to relax in. The room was very quiet with no noise from Rome and the only time I heard anything was a noisy guest coming back one evening letting his room door slam opposite to us. The breakfast in the morning was in the breakfast room next to the reception and was, as usual, very, very clean. You could either sit outside under a canopy of vines (with grapes hanging down!) or under an awning. All in good condition and tasteful. We had a cappuccino every day with different sprinkles in a shape on top each time! The food was nice, with a selection of cereals, pastries, cakes, meat & cheese, fruit and spreads for toast. Several juices and a smoothie were also available. When it came time to check out we were very sad to go and really enjoyed our time in Rome. The staff made it easy for us and let us borrow their electric travel adapters and also let us store our luggage in their lock up behind the lift after we checked out and before our car picked us up. We were very pleased that we chose Hotel Artorius and would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!! Great location and fantastic room!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2MB2009
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent five nights at the Hotel Artorius and it was the perfect hotel for our stay in Rome!!!! An easy fifteen minute walk from Termini (the main train station) and an even easier ten minute walk to all the major sites of Ancient Rome (Colosseum, Forum), this hotel is perfectly situated on a quiet street minutes from the heart of Rome! We had a beautiful triple room with an amazing private terrace that was quiet, clean and very spacious for the three of us. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and the breakfast, on a lovely indoor/outdoor terrace, was plentiful, fresh and delicious (filling enough to make a light lunch the only snack required until a fantastic local Roman dinner!)!! The location couldn't have been more perfect - we walked everywhere (except for one trip on the Metro out to Olimpico Stadium to see Springsteen) including the Vatican (about 40 minutes) and Borghese Gallery (half hour) and it was wonderful to have such a quiet respite after enjoying the busy streets of Rome all day. We are already planning a return trip to this amazing city and we will most definitely be staying at the Hotel Artorius when we go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TAEL
Reviews.Content: Everything that the previous reviewers had said and more, the location is great, the hotel is truly a gem. Great breakfasts and lovely cappucino's. The hotel is spotless, secure and the balcony was a fantastic spot to just chill out at the end of days walking. As before, the restuarants recommended were great, location was perfect for walking/catching bus to vatican etc. Loved it and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very helpful staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: larrydej
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel in central Rome. Perfect location to get to most of the main attractions around the city. The staff prepared a full breakfest buffet with a cozy seating area which allowed us to meet other guests from around the world. The staff spoke very good English and all of the restaurant recommendations were perfect. The best part was when I emailed them for directions from the airport they responded promptly with three options. The one I chose was to be picked up by one of their employees. He was waiting in the airport with a sign. The cost was only slightly higher than a taxi. It was definitley worth the peace of mind they provided.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pauli_7
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice of hotel for people wanting to be central, and being prepared to walk to the main sites rather than be on the main transport routes. Head in one direction and you can be at the Vatican in 30 minutes, and in the other to be at the Colosseum and Forum in 10 minutes. The staff are very pleasant and helpfu. My criticisms would be that the breakfast choice is limited and can get boring if you are there for more than a couple of nights. The room had two single beds despite asking for a double when booking. The room had very little natural light. Highlights are the location, the beautiful bathroom, and the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spot!”
Reviews.Author: GTHPTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at Artorius of 3 weeks away in Italy, all of our hotels were chosen from tripadvisor. We wished we had stayed longer here. In an old cobblestone section of Rome, walking distance from the train station and metro, we adored this hotel. Set off a narrow street that doesn’t seem like much from the outside, the room was immaculate, and the people, service & breakfast were awesome. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Callsergio
Reviews.Content: We found out during our trip that this was a very trendy. Absolutely spotless room and building. We were traveling for business as well as an extended stay to enjoy the city and were given a room with a terrace (too large to be considered a balcony). The staff was extemely attentive, often running after us to make sure that we were equiped with unbrellas... , and biding us a good day. Thanks Anna, Luca, Maurizio Alessandro, and mama and papa. So polite and great attitudes throughout are stay. We were even given Anna's calling card when she was made aware that we had phone troubles. Coffee came to our room covered, hot, and whenever we requested. I don't think they even added them up on checkout...they sensed the caffine addiction and were willing to supply us. Location... well! can it get any better? Colosium and shops, Via Nationale close by, Best ice cream and " il gelatone' one street over. Grocery shopping across the lane / street, and decent eateries scattered within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but it has some issues.”
Reviews.Author: dweisenberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area- in close proximity to much of historic Rome. Most rooms are well maintained and fairly modern; the triple we stayed in even had an outdoor patio. However we had some issues with the hotel. The first was that the beds were very low-quality and uncomfortable. Everyone in our group woke up with a stiff back in the morning. Further, the hotel staff reccomended us a Cristiana Roma tour that was not very good at all, as well as a restaurant right across the street that was mediocre at best. Overall this is not a bad hotel to stay at, but make sure you are aware of the uncomfortable beds and don't take the staff suggestions too seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Colleen S
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent find in a great quiet area of Rome. Centrally located, made it easy to walk to all of Rome's attractions and the hotel itself is wonderful. The staff were excellent, the food was beyond what I expected in the delightful breakfast room. Rooms were larger than I expected and very comfortable. Even the mini bar was extremely reasonably priced. I enjoyed every minute I stayed here and when I return to Rome I will most definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: fruitofthevine
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and are glad we took the advice to stay there. It is a great location and while it doesn't have a lot of amenities is perfect for Rome where there is so much to do outside the hotel. The staff have a great understanding of English and were very helpful with advice on anything we asked. The rooms are clean and an adequate size and the bathroom was nice. Breakfast was included and had many options to choose from and served in a pleasant atmosphere. The garden is small but quiet and a good place for an afternoon rest with a cup of tea or a gin and tonic. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: Rascallyroz
Reviews.Content: My 21 yo daughter and I stayed at Hotel Artorius on May 14. We arrived in Rome jet lagged and ready to stretch. They sent a driver to pick us up at the airport and tell us what we were passing as we drove into town. The hotel is small with a charming receptionist who checked us in and took us to our room. The room was a fair size considering we were in a large European city and the bathroom was great! Of course, by now, my definition of a great bathroom is one in which my husband, who's quite husky, could turn around in and not get stuck, that has good water pressure and large soft towels. It was a trifecta! The room was large enough for my daughter and myself to get comfortable but not really spacious. The really good part was it was quiet at night. I love that! And in the morning there was cereal, rolls, fruit and cappaccinos- a great way to start the day. It's walking distance to the Colloseum, Forum, etc as well as to Plaza Navona so the location was pretty good. No sidewalks though so watch the traffic. When we checked out we were going to an apartment that wasn't ready yet so they held our luggage for us for about 5 hours while we tooled around town. We're going back on Friday for one more night before I go home, and I'm really looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “A small oasis in a crazy city!!”
Reviews.Author: tjontario
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Hotel Artorius on the last leg of an italian tour. This hotel was truly a small oasis that you would miss if you did not watch for the small, discreet hotel sign on the wall. The rooms have been beautifully appointed with gorgouse fabric on the walls, incredible marble in the bathroom, it is evident that no expense has been spared to make these rooms stunning down to the last detail. Breakfast was delicious, fresh pastry every morning with a good cappucino was enough to keep us going for the day The staff were very accomodating in all aspects of our dealings with them, from recommending restaurants to helping us find our way back out of the city! Luca went out of his way to make our stay truly a great experience, in making phone calls for us to confirm car rental information, dinner reservations and getting our internet hook up in place. A word of advice, do not drive your car into the heart of Rome, we learned the hard way. Traffic can be horrendous and while streets are clearly marked on maps, the direction in which they run is not! This is a hotel I would definitely return to!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: dvdmgsr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artorius is a very well-maintained, friendly, small hotel on a small street in central Rome. It is in a very convenient location: the Forum, Colosseum, Trevi fountain are a short walk away, and you can catch a bus to the Vatican easily from very close by. Our room was of a decent size for a triple, and very comfortable and spotless. The staff were very cordial and went out of their way to help. The only thing keeping it from getting a "5" is that I expect a nicer room for the price we paid. Granted, there was nothing wrong with the room at all, and prices in Rome are very high in May, but neither the room nor the value warranted a "5" for me. A "4" is pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oakley12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other reviews, and we are so glad we did. The hotel is wonderful. It is close to many attractions, the staff were extremely helpful with regard to places to eat, and the complimentary breakfast was delicious. The rooms were clean and spacious and beautifully decorated. If we ever get back to Rome, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: eddiedenc
Reviews.Content: We recently booked this hotel based on other reviews from this site, and we were very happy with our choice. The hotel is quaint and the staff was very helpful and accomodating. The location is great and was just a 10 minute walk to many attractions. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. We would definately stay here again. Loved it. (Charlotte, North Carolina)

Reviews.Title: “A favorite place to return”
Reviews.Author: SeekerofSun
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Artorius are the greatest. They are glad to assist you with anything that a weary traveler needs. They set up a tour for us, gave a advice on restaurants and provided help in many ways. The breakfast is good and is served in a room with a lot on ambience. This is a good place to have a glass of wine later in the day. The location is excellent for the major points of interest in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gotravel47
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at Hotel Artorius for two nights this past week. I chose this hotel based on T.A. reviews and we were favorably impressed. The young man who works at the front desk and serves breakfast spoke very good English and helped us with our Metro tickets, as well as a taxi reservation on day of departure. I was impressed with the bathroom (sounds petty, but having spent 6 previous nights in a hotel with a very small bathroom, it was important)--both decor and size. Noise was very low, location was convenient and price was fair. It would have been helpful to have wireless Internet, bu the Ethernet cable that the hotel provided work just fine.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It´s just great!”
Reviews.Author: PekkaTurku
Reviews.Content: We have been four times in Rome and slept in three hotels. Hotel Artorius is the smallest of those - but it´s athmosphere was most kind and warmest. It´s situation is perfect: near by everything but at the same time it´s very peaceful oasis. The street in front of the hotel is very narrow and quiet. You can leave your earplugs home, because there´s just silence in the night. And still you are living in the middle of the noisy Rome, near Colosseum, San Pietro in Vincoli -church and shopping street Via Nazionale. There are plenty of great little tavernas and ristorantes near the hotel, so you don´t have to go far to have a good dinner. The personnel of the hotel is very, very kind and helpful. Their smiles are natural, not as acted. The rooms, toilets, stairway and the corridor are very clean. The breakfast is very versatile and abundant and you can have capucchino, espresso, tea, hot chocolate or american coffee. What more? The only thing which wasn´t as good as in "our former hotels", was the view from the room window. But as I said, the street IS very narrow and it´s just impossible to have a great view. But because the street is very narrow, it´s also very, very quiet. And having a good sleep at night is much more important than some great view. Thank You, the staff of Hotel Artorius. You are the heart of this little excellent hotel! We´ll recommend Artorius to everyone who´s planning a holiday in the wonderful eternal Rome. Grazie e arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the family-run Hotel Artorius”
Reviews.Author: JBond214
Reviews.Content: Summary: Hotel Artorius is a small, friendly, warm, welcoming family-run hotel, in the heart of a real Roman neighborhood with good dining options close by, it is only a couple of blocks from the Colosseum and walking distance to all of the other major sites in Rome (including the Vatican, if you are up for a 30-40 minute walk). Highly recommended. Pros: Close to everything, family-run, breakfast included, clean, newly renovated rooms and bathrooms, rooms and bathrooms are large by European standards (especially if you pay a few extra Euros for a triple room). Personal attention and friendly people. Cons: Small hotel, so no large hotel amenities (i.e. no room service, no restaurant). Review: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Artorius in February 2009. Allesandro (see photo) and his family (and some family friends) run the 10-room Hotel Artorius. Everyone at the hotel made us feel as though we staying with friends in the guest room of their house. Allesandro would make wonderful coffee and cappuccino for breakfast each morning, along with a light breakfast of cereals, pastries, breads, fruits, juices, yogurts and some meats/chesses. The breakfast was served in a small covered dining room, outside in the main courtyard (see photo). The hotel is in the heart of a real Roman neighborhood and is only a couple of blocks to the Colosseum (see photo from one street over from the hotel). The hotel and surrounding area is very safe, just keep in mind you are in the heart of a large city. The hotel is small, but newly renovated. It is located on a small one-way side street, close to the main streets of Rome (e.g. Via Nationale). There are numerous good dining options in the neighborhood. Just walk out the hotel pick a direction, wander around for a bit and you are sure to stumble across a good place to eat. We recommend ordering the house wine at whatever restaurant you eat at. The staff is also more than willing to make a recommendation or reservation for you. Right across the street is a small supermarket where you can purchase everything from basic supplies (waters, sodas, wine, beer) up to a picnic lunch. There is a subway stop only a couple blocks away. The rooms and bathrooms are newly renovated and are relatively large by European standards. We stayed in a standard double room (see photos). Nonetheless, we looked in at some of the triple rooms, and they we considerably larger. If you are concerned about space, it is worth the extra Euros to upgrade to a triple room. If you are not overly concerned about space, a double room should suit most couples perfectly well. Another consideration is that most of the triple rooms overlook the interior courtyard whereas the double rooms overlook the street out front (with the usual Vespa and car traffic). Because some of the other reviews indicated that cabs from the airport had difficulty locating the hotel, we emailed Allesandro in advance of our arrival with our flight information. Allesandro scheduled a driver to meet us at the airport (with our name on the board and everything). The ride was 50 Euros (a standard cab from the airport is 40-50 Euros), so the scheduled ride was well worth it. Another option is the express train from the airport to the Termi Train Station which is about 6-7 blocks (and a 10 minute walk) from the hotel. After staying in Rome for a week, we headed off to Venice for a couple of days. Make sure to check out our review of the Hotel Al Ponte Anico in Venice. If you stay at the Hotel Artorius, make sure you say “hi” to Allesandro for us! Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Very freindly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Glaws
Reviews.Content: Strange really - can't decide what makes this hotel so special, but I feel it is. The staff certainly help - they look like family members and they do bend over backwards to help. The 100 year old lift adds to the place as do the very comfortable and clean rooms. Would love to experience the outside dining in Summer but in February it was merely OK. If you after a full English breakfast - this is not the place - a good selection of continental breakfast food is what you'll get. Location is excellent - 20 min to Station, 10 mins Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. The hotel is down a quietish back street with quite a few restaurants and bars nearby - we had no problems with noise. It's got something and I'm not quite sure what - which probably explains why it's so highly rated. Would I go back - to right I would.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: amyc82
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artorius is located on a lovely side-street off the busy Via Nazionale, and is within walking distance to all of Rome's major sites. We had a triple room, which was quite spacious, with a large private balcony that we enjoyed. The included breakfast was served in a cute covered patio and was quite large for European standards. The highlight of the breakfast had to be the freshly baked croissants and cappucinos! The cappucinos were decorated with unique designs on top and put a smile on our face each morning. I was sick one morning, and my parents went to breakfast without me. When they informed the hotel staff that I was sick, they brought up a huge array of hot tea, croissant and other goodies to make me feel better. I thought this was extremely thoughtful and kind. We also got cappucinos delivered to our room on another occasion. The hotel staff were always there to help out, whether it be by bringing our luggage up to the room or loading it into the taxi. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend Hotel Artorius to other travelers without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-round”
Reviews.Author: gilmorehill
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrific hotel on all counts - location, cleanliness, quality of accommodation, staff, breakfast. It was within easy walking distance of all the sights and the Termini and there were good restaurants in the surrounding streets. The area is very traditionally Roman with lots of interesting little shops and bars. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: hjrich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Artorius during early November 2008. The room (with queen size bed and private bath) was spacious and always clean. The staff was extremely courteous and certain staff members had a good command of English. The location was wonderful and the staff regularly helped us with directions. The morning breakfasts were very enjoyable as well. It was an excellent experience and far outweighed our expectations. We recommend the Hotel Artorius without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 1Coaster
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The room was excellent, the staff was very nice and it was in a good location. The included full breakfast was a real plus. Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reedeg
Reviews.Content: We booked thr Artorius for 7 nights in November based on reviews in Tripadvisor and could not have been more pleased. We always prefer small family run hotels and the Artorius was among the best in our travels over the years. It has obviously been recently remodeled and we thought very well done with fabric coverings on the walls, crown moldings, and cherry wood furniture. We found double room with balcony to be very large by European standards and the bathroom was both large and beautiful and so clean. Service was friendly and efficient without exception. Nothing was too much to ask. Breakfast was fresh with enough variety and served in a very pleasant breakfast room. The location for us was perfect. I know a lot of people like to stay by the Pantheon or Piazza Novona but we find those areas to be clogged with tourists day and night. The Monti neighborhood is a "real" neighborhood with a supermarket, lots of restauants and non-touristy shops. Especially liked the Spazio Artigiano shop with beautiful hand made ceramics at very reasonable prices at Vicolo dei Serpenti, 13. Via Nazionale is just two blocks. Most sights are easily walked with multiple bus options or metro if you prefer (espically for the Vatican). I have been to Rome many times and cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Some people have noted water problems in the shower and there is some flucation in the pressure that requires you to adjust the hot/cold at times but this seems very minor. The water pressure was wonderful with plenty of hot water at all times. No real negative comments except they could add some artwork to the rooms. We would also have liked more English TV selectoins, not that we come to Rome to watch TV but at the end of a long day it is nice to relax with something other than BBC world news.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, very friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMount-travellers
Reviews.Content: From the time my wife and I arrived by taxi at the front door of this hotel for our 5 night stay, we were made to feel very welcome by owners Maurizio and his brother Alesandro. The hotel and our room were always very clean and well serviced. The individually -controlled air-conditioning worked well in the hot Rome weather (early September, 35plus degrees C). Maurizio was always cheerful and very helpful with any of our enquiries (local restaurant & sightseeing etc). Can heartily recommend "Il Grillo Brillo" in Via dei Serpenti (2 minute walk) for friendly service and good food especially the homemade Lasagne and Tiramisu. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to most major sights (Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Colosseum, Ancient Rome, Vittorio Emanuel Monument & Museum). Our warmest thanks to Maurizio and staff for helping to make our holiday in Rome very happy and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DimKat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day/3 night trip to Rome. We chose to stay in the Artorius hotel, after reviewing the reviews on Tripadvisor and Venere. What we read had raised our expectations and maybe this is why we can not agree with other reviews. Starting with the positives, location was good. It is centrally located, indeed, close to Trevi fountain, Termini station and Colloseum. It is also very clean. Now for the negatives… 1) The hotel is 2 star, and not 3, according to the sign on the room door. 2) We booked this room from September 7th for the price of 160 euros. We checked the price one week before leaving, and the price remained the same. If looking for a better bargain then, don’t hurry to book. 3) The room (106) was small. I can not compare it with other hotels in Rome but compared to Paris, Prague, Vienna hotels, this was a VERY small room. 4) The bathroom ventilation remains open and you can not close it, resulting in a buzzing noise. 5) You couldn’t adjust the shower in a certain height, because the handle was broken. We noted this after the first day and they said that this was something they could fix. However, up to our last day the handle remained broken. Furthermore, the water temperature in the shower was going from hot to cold and vice versa. So after a long and tiring day staying under the shower for a few minutes was out of the question. 6) The breakfast was very poor, without refilling the buffet. One type of cheese, one of salami, and one of ham, was all we got. When bread was consumed, they didn’t put some more. I didn’t ask for more, maybe they would then provide us some more. To my conclusion, this hotel is highly overpriced. I would be willing to pay something approximately 100-120 euros for this kind of service, but I can not recommend to pay 160 euros for a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Redtexcat
Reviews.Content: Checked in with my mother after a couple of weeks of traveling. Have been to Rome several times in the past but always stayed with friends. This time we wanted to be close to the city center. We found the hotel easily (thanks to RomeCabs) and to the pics posted on Trip Advisor. Very friendly the minute we walked in. They helped with all the luggage, which was no small feat. The location cannot be beat. Breakfast was super. They even let us eat early one day when we left before breakfast "opened" at 7am. Liked the extra security they had (cameras of entrance behind the front desk, special opener to access the main hallway). Rooms were quiet, even though we faced the street (room 106). Compared to most European rooms, these were big. Individual a/c control was also very nice to have. Could not be more pleased with the service.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BadRtKnee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in October of 2008. Coming from a bad choice of hotel in Santorini, Greece, I was pleasantly surprised by the quiet, neat and clean room at Hotel Artorius. The bathroom was quite spacious and immaculate. Its location is within walking distance from Stazione Termini/Metro Station and many sites to see, including Colosseum, Vittoriiano, Trevi Fountain, two of the three Museo Nazionale Romano, Roman Forum, and Pantheon. It is run by a family of a nice couple and their two sons. The small courtyard for breakfast is perfect to get your day started. Being locals, the owners can advise you easily on where to find good restaurants. I had a most wonderful stay and strongly recommend it to anyone considering visiting Rome, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Artorius deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: rondi3
Reviews.Content: Based on TA reviews we stayed at the Artorius for three nights in late September. We had a triple room (for two), so we had plenty of space. The hotel is very nicely appointed, immaculate, and well staffed. The staff were very helpful when one of us mislaid her wallet, which she eventually found exactly where she had put it in her suitcase. Staff members went to great lengths to help us search for it. They also give excellent advice on restaurants, etc., and will help you organize sightseeing and taxis. The hotel is in a great location central to the Colosseum, the Palatine, the Capitoline, and Roman and Trajan's Forums. Bus routes are nearby, and the Cavour Metro stop is 5 minutes away on foot, so you can reach the National museums, Trevi, Spagna, the Pantheon, the Vatican, Piazza Navona, and of course, Galleria Borghese. The hotel offers an excellent breakfast on the terrace, which is covered and heated on cool days. If you want an excellent boutique hotel in the best location in Rome, choose the Artorius.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: GOBLUE80
Reviews.Content: VERDICT: Artorius is a nice hotel in a great part of Rome. Our room was exceptionally clean and comfortable, although quite small. Rome's attractions are minutes away on foot, as are some great restaurants and shopping. Termini train station is also very close. BIGGEST COMPLAINT: Our only complaint is the cramped size of the room and bathroom. ROOM: Aside from size, the room was very clean and decorated with modern furniture/fixtures. The bathroom was sparkling clean every day. The bed is fairly comfortable, and there is internet access in the room. Our view was of the alley where you enter the hotel; but since it's off an alley, noise is minimal, which makes for easy sleeping. AREA: Artorius is close to Termini train station (5 minute taxi ride = 10 Euros). It is within walking distance of the Colloseum, Palatine Hill and most other ancient attractions. Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon were a bit further, but still walkable. The Vatican is easy to reach by subway. Overall it's a great location in a safe, well lit area. Restaurants are close and plentiful, as is shopping. SERVICE: Very good - friendly, good English and helpful with directions and suggestions. FOOD: The complimentary breakfast is very good with lots to choose from. Yogurt, crossaints, rolls, ham/cheese, fresh fruit shake, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: fosters14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Artorius for two days and loved everything.Staff professional and efficient, rooms clean and breakfast excellent. Rome is fantastic and will come back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: qnutah
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. I can't say anything negative, the location (Approximately 10-15 minutes walking from the Colloseum) was great, the staff was very helpful and friendly, and the rooms were nice and big and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to it's reputation on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: dmbkDallasTX
Reviews.Content: We chose Artorius after reading the reviews on TA. The hotel did not disappoint. Spotlessly clean. Staff was very helpful, friendly and attentive. Breakfast in their courtyard is very nice. Would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Catastrophe”
Reviews.Author: Gentlemanjohnny
Reviews.Content: Disaster. Inaccessible even by taxi. Stuffy room with a/c in the whole hotel turned off, a promised quiet room on the street is a catastrophe, early 10am check-out offensive. Unless you are guaranteed a large room on a high floor in the back, cancel your reservation. It's clean for sure, but no extra pillows, bleak design inside the rooms, Overall BE WARNED.The plastic flowers in the lobby should tip you off. And at 180 Euros for a double, it's not even the greatest deal if it was good. That Trip Advisor can have so many positive reviews mystifies me, and frankly , it scares me off trusting TA again. They are'nt unpleasant here but just do not recognize the reality of what at least the street side rooms offer. Stay away. We found other hotels in neighbourhood (Four star btw) available for same price, it emerges, and much nicer...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in a large city can be intimidating and I often use trip advisor to help me make a choice. Hotel Artorius was a good choice. The room was small by North American standards but it was nicely decorated, extremely clean and comfortable. The location is excellent for exploring Rome and there are a number of good restaurants nearby. The staff is extremely friendly and accomodating with lots of advice. Breakfast is excellent and served in a lovely courtyard. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again..”
Reviews.Author: DebJD
Reviews.Content: Great all round; spacious clean well appointed room, windows onto street with double glazing & shutters...peaceful if u want. Good breakfast in nice setting. Helpful pleasant staff Located so well in Rome - can walk to many of the main attractions. A good deal. If they added wi-fi it would get 10.5 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: plcape
Reviews.Content: Hotel was terrific. The rooms were well appointed, very clean and current. (although small) The staff was extremely helpful answering all questions about Rome , very patient and knowledgable. The breakfast was very good being and being outside was nice. Would definetly go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Artorius”
Reviews.Author: NATASHA42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artorius for 3 nights from 10th to 13th September and it was perfect for us. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our room (103) was clean and a good size with windows opening out to overlook the street below, which I like, and the double glazing cut out any noise if you wanted to be quiet. Breakfast was good and served in a very pleasant terrace area. The hotel recommended a restaurant just around the corner which served good food at a reasonable price. We found the location very convenient as we were able to walk everywhere without any problems. I would most definitely stay here again on another trip to Rome and would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: wahnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 3 nights... Hotel Artorius was a nice find for us. Our room was quiet, the air conditioning was strong, and the bathroom was nice. They have a great little breakfast bar with delicious "right out of the oven" pastries, rolls, ham, salami, cheeses, cereal, yogurt and juices.... oh and GREAT coffee. There is also a supermarket about 15 feet from the front door to get your soda and snacks. The location is pretty good... on a quiet street and close to most attractions (be prepared to walk a LOT in Rome). The bus stop is right down the street. We walked to the Forum/Colosseum and took a short bus ride to the Vatican. The staff was friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. There are a lot of nice little restaurants nearby. The negatives: there were no English-language TV channels... since we didn't have a computer, we had no clue what was going on back home. Also, there is no in-room safe... so we ended up carrying most of our valuables and cash with us when we went out.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: farfallemdt
Reviews.Content: I have one thing to say- central air. I know that some people don't care about this but it was great to come back to the room for a siesta after walking around all day in the heat. It really refreshed us for an evening adventure. Everything is walking distance and the buses or metro is easily accessible. The breakfast was just ok. The staff was nice and helpful. The price is a bit high but for what you get and the location it seemed reasonable. I've been to other central Rome hotels and paid around the same, this was the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cartripper
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days at the hotel and just to repeat what all other have said, this hotel is great. It is exactly what we were looking for and in a great location with the bus number 64(pickpocket express) stop right at the top of the street. We used the bus frequently and never felt uncomfortable. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were cleaned to a very high standard every day. The staff were lovely and helpful. We had a balcony room(108) and it was fab to have somewhere to sit outside with a glass of wine or 2/3 before going out for our evening meal. The breakfast was plentiful and the cappuchino with the little designs on top put a smile on your face every morning. They also made a great smoothy. There was no safe in the room but we left our money in a suitcase along with our passports and felt they were very safe as there is a locked door to get onto the hotel room floor. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of travelling to Rome. Great city and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: keysmia
Reviews.Content: I could have not chosen a better hotel. I am a second generation Italian American raised in New York City and this was my first trip to Rome. I took a taxi from the airport, which cost 45 euros. The hotel is situated on a quiet side street in the ancient Rome neighborhood. I checked in with no problems took a nap and ventured out into the neighborhood. I was amazed to turn a corner and see the Coliseum. The Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain is also within walking distance or you can take an electric bus for 1 euro to get you there. It was a perfect location for me. You are in a real safe neighborhood with cafes and restaurants at every corner. The staff is very nice and helpful with anything you may need. The rooms are so clean it reminded me of my Grandmother’s house where you could eat off of the floors. Anna was especially helpful and set up a few tours and told me how to get around. I loved it and am extremely happy with my choice. The rooms are clean, comfortable with Internet access. They even have Ethernet cables for you to use as well as ac adapters. The shower was great, the breakfast was also really nice and they have a little open-air garden for you to eat in. I booked the hotel through Orbitz and though no fault of the hotel, Orbitz charged my credit card when booked but it did not go through and never notified me or sent the payment to the hotel. This was worked out at 6 am in the morning. My advice is to double check with Orbitz when booking from the U.S. I will definitely return next year and would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: frantically_calm
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the overwhelmingly positive feedback from TripAdvisor I booked our little family early into this hotel (my wife and I and our 10-year-old daughter). To be honest it was a bit of a splurge to mark the end of our holiday but it's difficult to find any faults with the Artorius. Lovely triple room, immaculate bathroom, great air conditioning. Friendly staff and a lush courtyard breakfast area. And despite the business of Rome this is a quiet street, fifteen minutes from the Coliseum. It was a bit of a hike (20 minutes) from the station but we very much liked the neighbourhood. There's a small supermarket just outside the front door and a variety of interesting restaurants and wine bars.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Updated and Friendly, but Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: rainman2000
Reviews.Content: We completed a week long cruise in Rome, and decided to find a good boutique hotel to use as our pad for a few days before returning home. Because we had luggage, we took a taxi from the local train station so we wouldnt have to walk forever to find this hotel. Unfortunately, after the taxi found the street, he couldnt actually find the hotel. He left us off about a block away and we needed to go into another Inn to ask for directions. Sure enough it was indeed on the same street but we drove past it twice and never saw it! Its a small quiet side-street that has only a few Inns with signs. This hotel has a small bronze plaque, so its hard to see. But after arriving, we were greeted by the son (family business for sure) and from that point on we were very very satisfied! The hotel room are mostly on the second floor (we think). There is a broad stairway up, but the son that greeted us insisted we take the ancient lift...which apparently is one of the oldest working lifts in Rome. The second floor had security so things seemed safe. The room was modern and updated with a king bed that was quite comfortable. Really nice updated bathroom (with bidet) and a nice new shower. Very nice marble everywhere. The room had high ceilings, air conditioning, and a TV. All features were quite nice, however the TV was a bit hard for us to figure out. An internet cable was provided for free, so we were able to stay connected. The one window looked out to the building across the street, so there we no view and no balcony, but we didnt care about that given everything else we had to go see in Rome. The hotel is not too far from the Coliseum and the Forum. Its an easy 10 minute walk. Plenty of restaurants nearby....and the hotel has some local favorites that were really really tasty. The neighborhood seemed safe at night too. Breakfast was provided in an outdoor patio - which was clean, refreshing and erelaxing. Plenty of breakfast food - but not your typical "English Breakfast". So we are happy to recommend this hotel and would stay there again. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there! (Jennifer, Chandler, AZ)”
Reviews.Author: JSKChandler_AZ
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I started to look at hotels in Rome, we were overwhelmed with the options. So we turned to Trip Advisor and after reading many reviews we chose Hotel Artorius. We couldn't be HAPPIER that we did. We just returned from a six night stay and wish we were still there! The staff was extremely friendly, the property was beautiful, the breakfasts were delicious, and the room was probably the cleanest hotel room we have ever stayed in. We found our room to be spacious (Room 108) and loved having a balcony to enjoy a gelato or bottle of wine! Hotel Artorius is in a perfect location for seeing the city. It is centrally located within a few minute walk of the Colosseum, Roman and Imperial Forums, Palatine Hill, Trevi Fountain and other Rome Highlights. Having a metro stop near by was also a plus. (If you will be staying several days consider purchasing the 1, 3 or 7 day metro pass.) There are many great restaurants and no lack of gelaterias in the area; we found a gelateria on Via del Serpenti that we visited several times! You will be more than pleased if you choose Hotel Artorius! It is simply perfect! (One note: although the hotel's website directions say to turn right on Via del Boschetto off of Via Leonina when coming from the Cavour Metro stop, the street is actually not marked as such. As a landmark there is American Yogurt Shop on the corner of the street to turn on and if you have reached Via del Serpenti turn back one street, you have gone too far!)

Reviews.Title: “Geat little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 183glen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the beginning of May for 3 nights and found it to be excellent. The location is ideal. All the main tourist sights are within walking distance. It is in a quiet side street. We were spoilt for choice with the number of small restaurants in the same area, all good value. The room was very good and as good as many 5* hotels we have stayed in. All the staff were very friendly and always smiling. I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Artorius is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DaBazoom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Artorius in Rome in April 2008. and Found it spectacular! We had an incredibly quiet room in a VERY NOISY city! Coming back to our room at the Hotel was like coming back to an Oasis. The Hotel is small, but very clean. Our room was a very nice size and again, very clean. The breakfast was good with pastries, salamis, etc. Typical fare for Italian tourist breakfasts, but there is lots of it and good quality. The staff were very nice and helpful. They gave us excellent advice and directions for getting to lots of places and getting a taxi. For people who are coming to Rome for the first time, the Hotel Artorius is very well located next to the colusseum, forum, and other attractions and a very short, easy taxi ride to other locations. There are also a lot of good food and an internet cafe near the hotel. My husband and I travel with a Guide Dog for the Blind, which the Hotel accepted without even blinking. For the dog, the location lacked grass or planters for relieving, but it is easy for us to pick up and the ease and relative inexpense of taxis because of the location made up for it. I would highly recommend Hotel Artorius to anyone traveling to Rome. Enjoy! No photos of the rooms, but they were very nice. Comparable to any major American Hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany29
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for seeing Rome. Rooms small but nicely furnished, bathrooms excellent. Whole hotel spotless. Breakfasts brilliant and hotel owners and staff very helpful and accommodating. Have no hesitation in recommending to anyone looking for a location which is within easy reach of most of the attractions the city has to offer. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: ChasMichealMicheals
Reviews.Content: Again we booked this hotel based on its good reviews. First impression when you enter is Wow what a lovely building, it has so much charactor with the old cage type lift etc, the place is immaculatly kept, the staff are attentive and friendly, always service was warm and with a smile, we were put in the escalator with our bags and met when we reached out floor, we were shown to own room and shown how everything operates. Not even a hint that this was done to obtain a tip for same. The room was a good size for Rome, nice bathroom and good shower. We also had a terrace which was a nice outside space. The standard of the furnishings is very high, very reasonable priced mini bar, comfortable bed. Breakfast is served in a marquee type structure outside but again very well done. The price we found good considering you are in the centre of rome. You are within 10 mins easy walking distance of most of the major sites. We would definately stay here again. If you are flying into Da Vinci airport be aware that it is 36km from the city, the train into termini is 11 euro each and from there it is one stop on the underground (1 euro), however if you like us have two cases to lug about a taxi while expensive is so worthwhile, as the cobbled streets are unforgiving!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: minibreaklady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend in March 2008 after reading reviews on trip advisor. The hotel has a 3* rating but I think it deserves more. Well located, we walked everywhere. The furthest sight was the Vatican but even this was only a 30 min walk and there is so much to see en route. The Colosseum is only 10 mins walk away. Our room was ready despite us arriving at 11am, which was a nice surprise. Our room was modern, had a big comfy bed and a very nice bathroom. The mini bar was reasonably priced and re-stocked every day. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was perfectly ample, with a help yourself buffet and some lovely fresh pastries. I would definitely stay here again. I think its very good value and a lovely hotel. I recommend the wine bar a few doors up the road, on the opposite side.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: celtictravellerWales
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Hotel Artorius. It is a little gem. The family that run it are so friendly and helpful...just ask and they oblige....extra pillow, early calls and even earlier breakfast. The rooms are on the first floor of what would seem to be an old townhouse very tastefully refurbished. The rooms are modern very clean with large marble bathrooms. plenty of towels changed daily. the hotel is central to all the main sites and a 20 min stroll from the termini station. Beware of the taxi drivers they will take you the long way and charge a fortune... ask the price before you get in!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tvplano
Reviews.Content: This is a family run bed-and-breakfast that has been in operation about a year. Breakfast buffet was substantial and was served in a covered outdoor gazebo with a grape vine growing overhead. Our room and bath were spotless. The high-tech remote light sensors and security sensors to open hallway doors were unexpected in this small hotel with just 10 rooms. Location was very convenient and safe at all times to walk to the Colosseum, Forum and Capitoline Hill. Good selection of Italian and Indian restaurants round the corner. The family speaks English and they were very helpful and friendly. They responded to emails promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: p31goal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artorius is a fantastic little hotel. It is centrally located, clean, nicely decorated and the owners are very friendly. I've stayed in other European hotels but this was by far the best! I honestly cannot think of a single complaint. The breakfast was exactly the same each morning but it filled us and the cappucino was great. :-) There are nice shops and restaurants all around the hotel also. And for a person like me (who must continue working while on "vacation") it was nice to find a hotel with FREE internet access. I would definitely stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Artorius
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Boschetto 13, 00184 Rome, Italy
